title: Senior Product Manager
job_function: Project Management, Information Technology, and Product Management
description:
**At Epidemic Sound, we make soundtracking content simple and inspiring with unlimited access to music and sound effects. Headquartered in Stockholm, with offices all over the world, we are a force of over 500 on a mission to soundtrack the world. Our innovative licensing model paves the way for creators - from YouTubers to small businesses to the world’s most recognizable brands such as Netflix, Redbull and BBC - to use sound to enhance their content while simultaneously supporting artists both financially and creatively. Epidemic Sound music is heard 2 billion times a day on YouTube alone and is recognized as one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies by the Financial Times. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital to name a few.**
**We are looking for a Senior Product Manager for our Sound Production and Music team. This role is located at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden.**
**Job Summary:**
 In this role you will work with a core domain of Epidemic Sound; the systems used for ingesting, managing, and distributing the music our artists provide for us. The team is responsible for building a strong data model and taxonomy for our music, efficient administrative tools, integrations with sound providers (e.g. Spotify), data pipelines for analytics and royalties, as well as great internal APIs for the other product teams.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Guide and manage the product roadmap, working with engineering, design, product colleagues and other stakeholders in the company to achieve Team, Domain, and Company goals
* Define, analyze, and monitor key metrics to measure success, and own initiatives to drive improvement
* Communicate plans, progress, and issues to both internal and external stakeholders
* Ensure delivery by keeping an eye on capabilities, engagement, resilience, and growth to empower the team


**Requirements:**
* 6+ years of driving technical product development initiatives, of which at least 3+ years as a PM in a software development org
* Proven track record of working with diverse set of stakeholders, both internal and external
* Experience from working in a modern, product-driven company with a strong product development process


**Preferred Qualifications/ Bonus Skills:**
* Experience from the music industry and/or sound production
* Having worked closely with external partners on integration projects, deal negotiations etc
* Technical understanding of e.g. SOA architectures and integrations
* Proficient with analytical tools and data-driven decision making


**Equal Opportunity Employer:**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
   

  

 Epidemic Sound, the market leading platform for restriction-free music, is headquartered in Stockholm, heard around the globe and on a mission to soundtrack the world.The company has democratized access to music for storytellers. Its innovative digital rights model paves the way for creators - everyone from YouTubers to small businesses to the world’s largest brands - to use restriction-free music to take their content to the next level, whilst simultaneously supporting the musicians it works with both financially and creatively.The company was co-founded in 2009, operates across the globe, and has offices in five major cities: Stockholm, New York, Los Angeles, Seoul and Amsterdam. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital, Alecta. AMF, and TIN Fonder and its Chairperson is Andrew Fisher, former CEO and Chairman of Shazam.

title: Head of KAM
company_industry: Food and Beverage Manufacturing, Food and Beverage Services, and Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
**Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?**
**Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.**
 Mondelez International in Sweden is the home of famous brands such as Marabou. We are now looking for a key senior leadership role within our Commercial organisation. Based from our fantastic site in Upplands Vasby, we are looking for a Customer Director to lead our teams in managing all key accounts across Sweden. Jointly with our marketing and category teams you work with defining, creating and delivering our commercial plans across all channels in Sweden. You are the owner of our commercial G2M strategies and lead our team to create strong crossfuntional partnerships with our customers.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute**
 You will:
   

  

* Develop and drive broad customer relationships across all levels with a key focus on building relationships at an appropriate level within the customer
* Define and execute the strategy for the customers and channels
* Lead the key account team to achieve great results
* Ensure the delivery of JCBP (Joint Customer Business Plan)
* Optimize the use of resources in order to obtain more profitability in the operations
* Support in the creation, definition and deployment of plans to maximise growth with in Sweden.
* Be a member of the Swedish Lead Team, reporting to the Country Lead for Sweden


**What You Will Bring**
 A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:
   

  

* In depth experience in Key Account Management, preferably in FMCG
* High level of in managing, leading and coaching teams including leading managers of others
* High strategic ability to understand the big picture and turn insights into actions
* Ability to create & develop long-term customer relationships
* Excellent communication, negotiation and presentation skills; excellent understanding of business financials
* Deep understanding of the Swedish retail landscape
* Fluency in Swedish and English is required
* A data driven approach and analytical mindset
* Master’s degree within business or other relevant area of study


**More About The Role**
 We are looking for a Customer Director to join our Sales team and lead our teams of Key Account Managers. Our ideal candidate has an ambition towards results-oriented commercial work and the strategic agility to understand the needs of our business and of your customers and channels. As an organization we place high value in having a growth mindset with great drive and the ability to question & challenge the status quo.
   

  

 You will own and develop our sales strategy, planning and execution across all of our customers and channels. You will lead a team of Key Account Managers and it is your responsibility that you and your team together deliver the expected company targets. As a manager you will make sure that your team has the right set of tools & capabilities to develop strong customer relationships and to drive business growth. You will work closely with our category planning & field sales functions to ensure the best implementation of our sales strategy across different categories, channels and in-store environments.
   

  

 Mondelez International is the number one snacking company in the world. This role has responsibility over our diverse portfolio of brands such as Marabou, Daim, Oreo, TUC and Philadelphia.
   

  

**Relocation Support Available?**
 No Relocation support available
   

  

**Business Unit Summary**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

*Our people make all the difference in our succes*
 Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   

  

**Excited to grow your career?**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

**IF YOU REQUIRE SUPPORT TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION OR DURING THE INTERVIEW PROCESS, PLEASE CONTACT THE RECRUITER**

 Regular

title: Fleet Operations Specialist
job_function: Other, Supply Chain, and Quality Assurance
description:
**At Voi, our mission is to create safe, sustainable, and reliable micromobility solutions that benefit everyone. We've been dedicated to this mission since 2018, and today, we proudly hold the position of the #1 e-scooter service in Europe, operating in over 100 cities with more than 250 MILLION rides to date.** 




**Our journey has been incredible, and we're committed to keeping the momentum going. As we continue to expand our operations in Sweden, we're excited to invite you to join us in Stockholm as a Hybrid Fleet Specialist.** 




**This role offers a unique opportunity to directly influence our fleet's readiness and contribute to shaping the future of European cities for generations to come.** 




**Are you ready to embark on the Voiage with us?** 




  





**YOUR MISSION AT VOI** 




 For the position as a Hybrid Fleet Specialist, you'll have the possibility of working in two different areas, depending on workload and suitability. We have our mechanical team, where you will be responsible for the maintenance and repair of our vehicles. This means keeping our scooters in top shape and provide strong support to our team on the ground. We also have our In field team, where you'll be utilising our vans to perform different tasks in the Stockholm area, making sure our operations runs as efficiently as possible. Here are some exciting tasks awaiting you as a Hybrid Fleet Specialist:
 



  




* Diagnosing and repairing broken vehicles
* Recycling and dismantling vehicles that cannot be repaired
* Redistributing vehicles from low-demand to high-demand areas and correcting improper parking
* Locating and collecting vehicles in need of transportation back to the warehouse
* Performing battery swap tasks in the city streets
* Ensuring the safe and compliant deployment of our vehicles and continuously gathering in-field insights to enhance vehicle availability, parking, and rider safety



  





**JOB CONDITIONS** 




 Note, this is an open application for candidates looking for a part time position. Since it's an open application, we have no set start date for a possible vacancy. The response rate from our side may be longer but when and if we have a need we will reach out and make contact.
 



  




* **Working times:** 
 Part time, rotating shifts including weekends
* **Contract type:** 
 Fixed term
* **Start date:** 
 To be discussed



  





 NOTE: our Talent Acquisition is based in Sweden, you will receive a phone call from a Swedish number (+46).
 



  





**WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO EMBARK** 




 We're looking for a highly motivated and responsible team player who can handle tasks and solve problems independently. With a proactive approach, you should be skilled in finding innovative solutions and achieving set objectives. In addition, the right candidate should have:
 



  




* A valid drivers license for Sweden
* Fluent english, both verbal and written and if you're fluent in Swedish it's a plus
* Previous experience with tools or mechanical practices
* General familiarity with digital tools and applications
* Local knowledge of Stockholm and experience driving in the city
* The ability to remain calm in stressful situations (such as difficult parking or traffic)



  





**WHY VOI?** 




 Working at Voi is more than just a job; it's a personal Voiage where you'll grow as a professional and be part of a diverse team and culture that's committed to making a positive impact on society. In addition to this, you'll have the opportunity to
 **:** 




  




* Join Europe's leading micromobility company and one of the fastest-growing scale-ups
* Make a direct impact on our ongoing success and contribute to the development of the micromobility industry in Sweden.
* Collaborate with inspiring, motivated, and diverse colleagues who share a common goal
* Be a part of the micromobility revolution and help create sustainable cities that are clean, quiet, and free from pollution

title: Managing Director Sweden
description:
Step into a pivotal role as a Managing Director for Sweden, where you’ll drive the growth and success of our brand in the Swedish market.
   

  

**What’s In It For You**
* Full Ownership Take full P&L responsibility for the Swedish market, shaping the future of our brand in Sweden.
* Strategic Impact Drive customer experience, lifecycle management, and marketing strategy to directly influence business growth.
* Revenue Growth Play a key role in monetizing customers and driving revenue, making a measurable impact on the company’s success.
* Leadership Opportunity Lead and develop a talented team of local experts and professionals.
* Market Influence Develop and implement market-specific strategies that align with local needs and trends.
* Brand Execution Ensure the successful execution of our brand’s vision in Sweden, directly contributing to the company’s regional expansion.


**Key Responsibilities**
* Full P&L Responsibility Own the full P&L of the Swedish market, driving customer experience, lifecycle management, and revenue growth through strategic initiatives.
* Team Leadership Lead and develop a best-in-class team of local experts and professionals, fostering a high-performance culture.
* Revenue Growth Monetize customers through effective strategies and initiatives, focusing on upselling, cross-selling, and maximizing customer lifetime value.
* Local Strategy & Planning Develop and implement market-specific strategies and plans. Manage the local budget and oversee quarterly local market and CRM plans in collaboration with Central teams.
* Customer Lifecycle Management Oversee the entire customer lifecycle, from acquisition to retention, ensuring a seamless and engaging customer journey.
* Marketing Execution Drive brand awareness through a mix of onsite and offsite marketing channels, ensuring alignment with market trends and local customer behaviour.
* Customer Engagement & Experience Ensure customer engagement through targeted marketing and optimized site experiences. Proactively identify opportunities to improve the customer journey.
* Operational Excellence Optimize daily operations to enhance quarterly performance and achieve annual revenue targets.
* Compliance Ensure all market executions comply with local regulations and company standards.
* Market Analysis Stay informed of industry trends, market conditions, and competitor activities to ensure the company remains competitive and innovative
* Market networking Take part of trade association work, regulatory forums and local media updates.


**Requirements**
* Education Bachelor’s degree in business, Marketing, Economics, or related field; MBA preferred.
* Experience Proven P&L management and business growth experience in the Swedish market, ideally in e-commerce, retail, or digital marketing.
* Leadership Strong leadership skills with experience in managing and developing high-performing teams.
* Market Knowledge In-depth understanding of the Swedish market, including customer behaviour, trends, and regulations.
* Analytical & Strategic Skills Data-driven with strong analytical skills and the ability to translate strategy into action.
* Customer Focus Passion for enhancing customer experience and engagement.
* Languages Native proficiency in Swedish and fluent in English.
* Compliance Familiarity with Swedish regulations, consumer protection, and advertising standards.
* Communication Excellent communication and presentation skills.


**CHALLENGE ACCEPTED?**
***By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy***

title: Account Executive - Nordics
description:
**About Workato**
 Workato is the only integration and automation platform that is as simple as it is powerful — and because it's built to power the largest enterprises, it is quite powerful.
   

  

 Simultaneously, it's a low-code/no-code platform. This empowers any user (dev/non-dev) to painlessly automate workflows across any apps and databases.
   

  

 We're proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world's top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning.
   

  

**Why join us?**
 Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a
 **flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles** 
 . We are driven by
 **innovation** 
 and looking for
 **team players** 
 who want to actively build our company.
   

  

 But, we also believe in
 **balancing productivity with self-care** 
 . That's why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.
   

  

 If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you!
   

  

 Also, feel free to check out why:
   

  

* Business Insider named us an "enterprise startup to bet your career on"
* Forbes' Cloud 100 recognized us as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world
* Deloitte Tech Fast 500 ranked us as the 17th fastest growing tech company in the Bay Area, and 96th in North America
* Quartz ranked us the #1 best company for remote workers


**Responsibilities**
 We are looking for an exceptional
 **Account Executive** 
 to join our growing team in the Nordics. In this role, you will manage focus on our mid-market segment, driving customer relationships from prospecting, qualification, close, to post-sales growth.
   

  

 Typical sales cycles may involve POCs, multiple stakeholders, strategic pricing negotiations, and selling to executives and CXOs.
   

  

 You will also be responsible to:
   

  

* Meet and exceed annual and quarterly ARR sales targets
* Maintain accurate pipeline management with expert-level forecasting
* Understand the product inside out, be technically proficient
* Understand customer needs and requirement
* Be a company builder
* Share best practices back into the organization


**Requirements**
**Qualifications / Experience / Technical Skills**
* Minimum 7 years experience in a full cycle, closing role.
* Experience handling and owning relationships with mid-market/commercial companies, including C-suite executive personas.
* Proven track record of consistently meeting or exceeding quota.
* English required plus at least one Nordic languages skill preferred, as this role will include coverage of clients based in all the Nordic region.


**Soft Skills / Personal Characteristics**
* An enthusiastic team player who's comfortable working in a fast-paced and evolving environment.
* A desire to build something new that can change the world, versus fitting neatly into a large company with an established static playbook.
* Not afraid to do outbound prospecting and passionate about being a builder in the region (conducting webinars, activities in the Nordics region, CIO Summits, customer dinners, etc).

title: Senior D365 SCM Supply Chain Consultant
description:
Join our Nordic ERP team of talented professionals and contribute with your expertise to help organizations achieve operational excellence and drive successful digital transformations using Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP. We partner with some of the biggest companies across the world, working together to improve business outcomes. We help not only well-established organizations move into the digital era, but also support innovative start-ups as they build their businesses.
   

  

**We**
* Have a wide variety of interesting projects to work with both locally and globally
* Provide you with a dedicated Career Adviser to support you during your journey at Avanade and who works together with you to create a personal development plan
* Welcome you to a team of engaged and helpful co-workers
* Have a wide range of different benefits such as employee stock purchasing, flexible work arrangements, a commitment to diversity and inclusion
* Provide the opportunity to work for Microsoft's Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 tears in a row), with a wide variety of development and training opportunities (80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Have offices in the major Nordic cities, and we support flexible work locations.


**Come join us**
 ERP is all about helping businesses simplify complexity and thrive in the digital age. You’ll be solving your client’s challenges and turning their needs into goals and solutions through Microsoft Dynamics 365.
   

  

 This role provides the opportunity to work for the Microsoft 1 Partner, with an unrivalled focus on development, global opportunities as well as a dedicated career advisor to support you through your career progression.
   

  

**Skills And Experiences**
* Strong consulting skills and client-facing experience with an implementation partner
* You have a passion for learning along with good business sense and time management
* You know how to manage your clients’ expectations effectively
* You’ve likely achieved a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field
* At least one full-cycle implementation of Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O or Dynamics AX OR experience supporting Dynamics 365 F&O as a strong user within the Supply Chain modules
* Experience with the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Supply Chain module
* Manufacturing and/or Supply Chain Management end-user experience nice to have but not required
* Experience managing/leading teams both on and offshore is nice to have, but not required


**About You**
 Characteristics that can spell success for this role:
   

  

* Consultative, collaborative, relationship builder
* Resilient, adaptable, flexible
* Intellectually curious and passionate about tech
* Convincing storyteller and engaging content creator


**What You'll Do**
 You will:
   

  

* Transform business requirements into a straightforward and technical model, and match processes to application requirements
* Prototype and configure processes in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations (F&O) to make sure the system works the way your client needs it to
* Run workshops with your clients, consultants, and client leaders to analyze and design solutions for any application, and handle gaps detected during prototyping
* Work with the technical team to make sure that your clients' needs are incorporated into the specifications and functions
* Create or evaluate a breakdown of your clients’ businesses processes so that you can identify and link functional and non-functional requirements
* Documents settings and prepare your clients to use the system
* Support testing the proposed system and train users


**Learn more**
 Apply today!
   

  

 To Learn more about Avanade Nordics, visit our home page.
   

  

 Interested in knowing what’s going on inside Avanade? Check out our blogs:
   

  

 Avanade Insights exchange ideas that drive tomorrow’s innovation
   

  

 Inside Avanade explore what life is like working at Avanade
   

  

**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you


  

  

 Find out more about some of our benefits Employee Benefits at Avanade | Avanade
   

  

**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!
   

  

 We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page.
   

  

  

  

 Create a future for our people that focuses on
   

  

* Expanding your thinking
* Experimenting courageously
* Learning and pivoting


  

  

 Inspire greatness in our people by
   

  

* Empowering every voice
* Encouraging boldness
* Celebrating progress


  

  

 Accelerate the impact of our people by
   

  

* Amazing the client
* Prioritizing what matters
* Acting as one

title: Product Design Director - Growth & Enterprise
description:
Our vision is to transform presentations, meetings and lectures by turning passive audiences into engaged contributors. We make this possible through our interactive presentation platform where the traditional presentation monologue becomes an inclusive dialogue. We believe in the power of together and that the most successful leaders listen to be heard.
   

  

 With Mentimeter, users become the best presenter they can be. Meetings become more productive, participants learn more and have fun whilst doing it.
   

  

 We have more than 300 million users and customers worldwide, on our way of making the world a better place, one presentation at a time.
   

  

**Overview**
 As a Product Design Director, you will shape and lead all aspects of product design within our Commercial product area. You will be responsible for the free-to-paid customer journey and partner with product and engineering peers to ensure that teams and individuals are empowered to build the best products.
   

  

 You will oversee each stage of the design process, always focusing on user and business needs. You will rely heavily on qualitative and quantitative data to make informed decisions.
   

  

 Together with the Engineering Director and Product Director, the Product Design Director is part of the Product Area Leadership. This trio partnership is responsible for strategic direction, teams and staffing, ways of working, processes and artefacts, impact, and results for the product area.
   

  

**Areas of responsibility** 
**Strategic Leadership**
* Define and execute a vision for product design within the Commercial area.
* Partner with Product Management and Engineering area leadership to define product direction, strategy, and objectives to reach business outcomes.
* Own the end-to-end customer experience, focusing on ease of use and value creation to promote a steady increase in overall product adoption, conversion, engagement, retention, and expansion.
* Ensure the strategic direction is tangible and well articulated, achieving a state-of-the-art user experience.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product management, sales, and marketing, to align design goals with overall business objectives.
* Orchestrate the customer journey that drives the Free-to-Paid journey and supports our Product-Led Growth (PLG) and Product-Led Sales (PLS) strategies.


**People Leadership**
* Coach individual Product Designers on craft-specific development and ability to successfully partner with other crafts in Product team trios.
* Lead and inspire a team of product designers to develop user-centered experiences that drive growth, retention, and engagement.
* Part of hiring product designers and working with the design leadership team to maintain and evolve the professional development framework.


**Craft Leadership**
* Part of Design Leadership - with the mission to provide a leading Designer Experience and nurture a culture of craft excellence at Mentimeter.
* Overall design vision and strategic design initiatives on a global, cross-area level in partnership with the Design Leadership team.
* Honing best practices and ensuring that the Design community and culture at Mentimeter are thriving
* Provide design leadership using your experience with analytics, research, design methodologies and product launches to drive best practices, scalable processes and holistic design approaches.


**So, who are you?**
* 5+ years of experience as a design leader, with proven experience in design leadership roles, with a track record of successfully managing and mentoring design teams.
* Experience managing and scaling design and product teams in fast-paced, hyper-growth environments.
* Strong leadership skills and the ability to guide teams through complex challenges.
* A craft expert who can be a thoughtful design partner when needed.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate design decisions clearly and advocate for the user experience to stakeholders at all levels.
* Deep expertise in product design, particularly in growth-focused environments, with an understanding of product-led growth (PLG) and product-led sales (PLS) strategies.


**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Once a year we also relocate to exciting places all over the world like Merida & Buenos Aires for our Toronto colleagues, cities in Europe (for our Stockholm colleagues), and cities in APAC (for our Sydney colleagues), paid for by us of course. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page .
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Insurance Practitioners to Guidewire Engagements
description:
**Location: Sweden, Stockholm**
 This is an extraordinary opportunity to build a rewarding career within Financial Services. Working in highly collaborative teams for world-leading clients, we will nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity.
   

  

 Our vision at Accenture Financial Services is to help financial institutions change to become more agile, digital and human. We create value for our clients by applying innovation and industry expertise at the intersection of business and technology.
   

  

**Description Of Role And Practice**
 We are looking for specifiers, developers, testers, project managers to help leading insurance companies to shape their digital strategy and business transformation and help them on their journey to grow their business and stay relevant for their customers. As part of the team, you will be working for some of the biggest financial institutions in the Nordics with a variety of project opportunities such as business transformation, digitalization, data and analytics and process design.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
- Be engaged in various projects with a wide range of topics: specification, development, testing, project management

- Develop, define, and implement strategies to help our clients solve their most critical problems within insurance, such as digital transformations, process governance and regulatory requirements

- As a specifier your task is to define the insurance processes and functionalities to be implemented on the Guidewire platform together with our customers' business

- As a developer or architect your task is the technical planning and implementation on top of the Guidewire platform

- A tester your task is to ensure the correct functionality of the solutions implemented on the Guidewire platform

- As a project manager your task is to lead large guidewire implementation projects

- Analyze and conceptualize business models, processes, and digital solutions

- Engage with the broader Accenture Financial Services community, as well as other Accenture organization groups to foster collaboration and support growth and development of the business and bring the best of Accenture to our clients

**Job Requirements**
 We expect you to have at least a couple of years of experience from a position within an insurance company. We would also like to see that you have:
   

  

  

- Solid experience in Guidewire platform

- Passion and drive to work with the Financial Services industry

- Good analytical and problem-solving skills

- Project management experience from Business or IT related change projects

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Swedish and English

- Entrepreneurial attitude, and good interpersonal skills

- Master´s degree (with major in Economics or similar) or equivalent with excellent academic results

**What We Offer**
- The opportunity to become part of the Technology Financial Services team working for the biggest insurers in Finland and the Nordics

- Collaboration with a Nordic network of talented, passionate colleagues and experts within your field of interest

- Mentoring and continuous evaluation that ensure your career continues to progress

- Great opportunity to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills

- Early leadership roles and opportunity to drive initiatives you are passionate about

- Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization

- Extensive education programs and development opportunities

- Volunteering opportunities locally and around the world

- A diverse and socially active workforce

- Benefit package with competitive salary, bonus, pension, health insurance, employee stock purchase program and other benefits

- Flexible work arrangements for maintaining work-life balance

**Apply now**
 We look forward to receiving your application. Apply online. Remember to attach CV and cover letter.

title: e2e Supply Controller to H&M!
description:
Here is a unique opportunity to a full-time consulting assignment as a e2e supply controller at H&M! In this role you belong to the e2e Supply Controlling team that have the main goal to maximize the high value of predictable demand assortment.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Finance / Law / Purchase
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, 6 months with good chance of extension
 



  

**Start date :**
 28 october
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 We are looking for an experienced
   

**e2e Supply Controller**
 to join the Supply Planning unit within the new e2e Supply Controlling team. This team’s primary objective is to maximize the value of our predictable demand assortment. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring that the right stock is available in the right warehouse, working closely with key cross-functional teams such as Assortment, Merchandising, Production, Logistics, and Supply Planning. Your focus will be on maintaining a healthy stock level that balances availability for customers and capacity at stores and warehouses.
   




**Work tasks**
  
* Collaborate with Assortment and Merchandising teams to set data-driven goals for predictable demand.
  
* Align e2e supply settings with business objectives, in partnership with Value Stream Supply.
  
* Manage and execute the e2e supply timeline with key functional leads, ensuring delivery of predictable items.
  
* Monitor and track key KPIs such as stock turnover, size curve availability, and supply vs. demand alignment on a weekly and monthly basis.
  
* Lead root cause analysis and create intervention plans to address off-track KPIs, ensuring long-term value delivery.
  
* Oversee stock levels and automatic carryover order placement at the article level.
  
* Provide input to Assortment and Merchandising teams on stock productivity for future demand planning.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* A university degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Supply Chain, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
  
* Minimun 2 years of experience in Supply Planning and Inventory Management, ideally within e-commerce or retail supply chains.
  
* Experience with Assortment Planning, or in Regional Supply & Demand teams, or a Supply Chain Planning role.
  
* A solid understanding of logistics strategies and supply chain operations.
  
* Proven problem-solving skills, with the ability to act swiftly and deliver sustainable results.
  
* Strong analytical abilities, using data to drive decisions and provide insights.
  
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
  
* Excellent skills in English (spoken and written)
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Susanna Humbla or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv1@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15107725

title: Financial Controller
description:
*Är du redo för en utmaning och vill ta stort ansvar inom finansiell rapportering? Bli en del av vårt fantastiska team på Länsförsäkringar AB och fördjupa dig i regelverksfrågor inom försäkringsverksamheten. Ansök nu och forma framtidens myndighetsrapportering tillsammans med oss!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som Financial Controller får du möjlighet att arbeta med några av dagens mest relevanta regelverk och rapporteringsutmaningar ur ett brett perspektiv. Du kommer att samarbeta nära med Senior Reporting Officer, Risk Management, IT och försäkringsverksamheten. Din huvudsakliga arbetsuppgift är att proaktivt delta i myndighetsrapporteringsarbetet avseende QRT/Solvens II tillsammans med andra medarbetare i teamet. Tjänsten är placerad på Länsförsäkringar ABs huvudkontor på Gärdet i Stockholm. Rollen som Financial Controller innebär en möjlighet att till viss del vara med och forma rollen inom området Solvens II-rapportering och att utveckla arbetsuppgifterna inom rollen.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Fungera som länken mellan verksamheten och den del av verksamheten där utveckling av nya/förändrade rapportmallar sker.
* Arbeta på en detaljerad nivå med QRT-rapporteringen och verksamhetens rapporteringsverktyg Abacus.
* Utreda, utvärdera och följa upp avvikelser i rapporteringen.
* Vara inblandad i kravställning för nya rapporteringsbehov.
* Aktivt verka för att effektivisera processer i vår resa mot en utökad automatisering.


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer att göra dig framgångsrik för denna tjänst:
   

  

* Mycket god och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet från försäkringsbranschen.
* En för tjänsten relevant högskoleutbildning
* Tidigare erfarenhet av Solvens II och myndighetsrapportering.


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av rapporteringssystemet Abacus eller liknande system.
* Förståelse för hur de olika delarna i Solvens II-rapporteringen hänger ihop.


 Som person är du lösningsorienterad och analytisk med ett sinne för detaljer. Utveckling och ständiga förbättringar motiverar dig. Du har förmågan att förstå och utreda detaljsamband, hitta felkällor och skapa åtgärdsplaner samt en vilja att utmana befintliga lösningar. Vidare är du självständig, ansvarstagande, stresstålig och leveranssäker Att arbeta i en dynamisk och tvärfunktionell miljö ska vara något som du tycker känns motiverande och spännande.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Du kommer tillhöra Ekonomi & Finans på Länsförsäkringar AB och rapportera till chef för gruppen Koncern- och Försäkringsredovisning. Ekonomi & Finans är koncernens gemensamma ekonomifunktion med ansvar för koncernens verksamhetsstyrning, finansiell rapportering, kapitalplanering och betalningsfrågor. Inom enheten finns avdelningen Redovisning som har det samlade ansvaret för den legala finansiella rapporteringen och myndighetsrapportering för Länsförsäkringar AB, Agria, Liv, Bankkoncernen och Fondliv.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-22**
*Hos oss är du med och påverkar ditt eget arbete – hela kulturen bygger på en hög grad av självledarskap, eget lärande och utveckling. Tycker du om att leda dig själv och utveckla din fulla potential kommer du att trivas hos oss.*

title: Nordic Health, Safety & Environmental Manager
company_industry: Food and Beverage Manufacturing, Food and Beverage Services, and Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
**Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelez International?**
**Join our mission to change the way the world snacks. Make It with Pride.**
 As our expert within Work Environment Management and Health, Safety & Environment (HSE), you take pride in your work and drive the cultural development regarding work environment, health and safety. Your proactive and strategic work will lead the Nordics Office locations (Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland) to become the best workplaces, with healthy employees, zero incidents and accidents.
   

  

 Since this role is within our business unit (including field sales) much focus will be on making sure we meet the relevant standards and regulations, according to local legislation, within organizational and social work environment.
   

  

 In addition, you will also be responsible for coordinating and overseeing implementation of all internal MondelezHSE standards, programs, processes and internal HSE initiatives.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute**
* Provide work environment and HSE expertise for the four locations, for all new projects/initiatives and change management activities.
* Practively contribute to HSE programs/initiatives (local/MEU programs/initiatives, requests from HSE Commercial Lead, country management requests etc
* Plan for and conduct trainings, coach and inform our leaders and their teams to create awareness and to drive a healthy and "zero accident/incident free culture"
* Ensure local legislation and standards are well understood and compliant with both country specific legislation as well as company regulations.
* Participate in investigations, follow up on identified non-conformances, facilitate closure of these and develops the systems to resolve them based on root cause analysis.
* Ensure appropriate risk assessments are conducted and follow ups are implemented to minimize or eliminate accidents, that might cause harm to anyone at our company location or within field sales.


**What you will bring:**
 A proactive approach and a desire to drive your future and accelerate your career with experience and knowledge in:
   

  

* Deep knowledge of Swedish work environment legislation and preferably in one more of the countries for which you will be working for.
* A relevant university degree within HR, HSE or equivalent training and experience that the Mondelēz deems equivalent. Preferably also a certification within HSE (Nebosh or equivalent).
* Several years of experience working with Systematic Work Environment Management (SAM) and HSE.
* Very good verbal and written communication skills in Swedish, English and preferably one more language, spoken in the countries you will be working for.
* An ability to inspire and cooperate with others at all levels, both internally and externally.
* Maybe write in full eg "Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) in a more generic way. It is part of our standards however key to have/do.
* Ensuring all First aid kit/Fire Extinguishers/Evac chairs/sprinkler system etc and other HSE related materials are frequently checked & updated/maintained according the frequency set
* Make all Permits to Work for all suppliers, not only FM supplier suppliers but also Mondelez International
* (Pro-)actively contribute to HSE programs/initiatives (local/MEU programs/initiatives, requests from HSE Commercial Lead, country management requests etc
* Pro-actively drive the HSE improvement agenda for the office, the Field Force and their teams


**More About This Role**
**Work schedule: 100%**
 The responsibilities of this position are performed within the framework of a regional business model that is defined and managed by Mondelēz Europe GmbH, Switzerland .
   

  

 No Relocation support available
   

  

**Business Unit Summary**
 At Mondelez Europe, we are proud, not only of the iconic brands we make, but also of the people who make them. Our delicious products are created in 52 plants across Europe by more than 28,000 passionate people. We are the top maker of chocolate and biscuits and a leading maker of gum and candy. We make sure our powerful global brands and local jewels like Cadbury, Milka and Alpen Gold chocolates, Oreo, belVita, LU and Tuc biscuits get safely into our customers hands—and mouths. Great people and great brands. That’s who we are. Join us on our journey to continue leading the future of snacking around the world by offering the right snack, for the right moment, made the right way.
   

  

 Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   

  

**Job Type**
 Regular
   

  

 Health, Safety & Environment
   

  

 Manufacturing

title: Marketing Executive
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Marketing Executive to join our growing Marketing Team in Sweden. As the Marketing Executive for Nya Expekt, your primary focus will be on sports marketing, where you will assist the Marketing Manager in executing campaigns in several areas whilst continuing to develop the fastest-growing sportsbook in Sweden. You will create engaging and tailored content while driving initiatives that not only meet but exceed our marketing goals.
   

  

 This role requires a creative and strategic thinker who is passionate about sports. You should have hands-on experience managing channels and running digital campaigns. Strong creative, written, and communication skills are essential, along with the ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize effectively, and stay ahead in a fast-paced environment.
   

  

 As a key player in our team, you will contribute to our sports-focused marketing strategy at a local level, managing everything from visuals and videos to copywriting and campaign execution.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Develop and Execute Marketing Strategies: Execute effective marketing strategies set by the Marketing Manager across various channels, focusing on driving growth, brand awareness and engagement.
* Content Creation: Develop compelling and engaging content tailored to our target audience, particularly in the sports betting sector.
* Campaign Management: Plan, execute, and optimise marketing campaigns to achieve key performance indicators (KPIs) and business goals.
* Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including design, product, and central marketing, to ensure cohesive and aligned marketing efforts.
* Analytics and Reporting: Monitor, analyse, and report on the performance of campaigns, providing insights and recommendations for continuous improvement.
* Community Engagement: Manage and engage with our online community, fostering a positive brand presence and building strong relationships with our audience.
* Market Research: Stay updated on industry trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences to inform marketing strategies and keep the brand relevant.
* Content Calendar Management: Maintain and update a content calendar to ensure consistent and timely execution of marketing activities.
* Brand Consistency: Ensure all marketing materials align with the brand’s tone, voice, and guidelines.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role
* Strong understanding of various local and global sports events
* Strong understanding of sports betting, particularly in odds-understanding
* Proven track record of driving customer growth through data-driven strategies
* Ability to thrive in a target-driven, fast-paced environment
* Proactive, organized, and analytical mindset
* Fluency in both Swedish and English is a must


 NICE TO HAVES:
   

  

* iGaming industry experience
* Passion for sport and in debt odds knowledge is a big plus
* Experience working with different marketing channels
* Familiar with casino and live casino verticals


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*
   

  

 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

title: Senior Manager, Intellectual Property Rights
company_industry: Machinery Manufacturing, Automation Machinery Manufacturing, and Industrial Machinery Manufacturing
description:
**Shape the Future with Valmet: IPR Leader Wanted!**
 Valmet, a pioneer in sustainable technologies, is now looking for a
 **Senior** 
**Manager,** 
**Intellectual Property Rights (IPR)** 
 for our Pulp & Energy Business Line. Join us in our quest to innovate and lead the industry while nurturing a greener world.
   

  

**As an IPR Leader, you will:**
* Develop and lead and Pulp & Energy’s comprehensive IPR activities, and report to VP Strategy and R&D.
* Lead a team of IPR professionals in our mission to protect and foster innovation on our continued way forward, towards excellence.
* Manage a strong patent portfolio that supports our commitment to eco-friendly solutions and ensuring that it’s robust and cost-efficient.
* Advocate for the IPR function within technology management team and Valmet’s forums.


**To be successful in this position we believe** 
**you to have:**
* A degree in technology, engineering, industrial management, legal or a related field.
* Extensive experience in IPR and/or pulp, paper, energy, or biorefining technologies, with an eagerness to expand your knowledge through continuous learning.
* At least 5 years of managerial experience and proven capabilities for a strategic approach.
* A collaborative teamwork focus and excellent communication skills in English.
* A proactive and systematic approach to work, with the capacity to operate autonomously and juggle multiple deadlines.
* The courage to challenge the status quo and drive innovation.


**We** 
**offer:**
* A key role within our IPR team, influencing our strategic direction, with a culture of innovation where your ideas can shape the future.
* The chance to challenge existing practices and contribute to the development of cutting-edge products and technical solutions.
* A stimulating global environment with ample opportunities for personal growth and an innovative and positive workplace with supportive and inspiring colleagues.
* Investment in your leadership, wellbeing, and sustainability knowledge.
* A position which can be based in any of our major Pulp & Energy locations in Sweden or Finland.


**Additional information:**
 For additional information please contact Ari Saario, VP Strategy and R&D, phone: +358 505902046 preferably on Monday October 14th 12:00 - 13:30 (EET Finnish time) and Friday October 18th 14:00 - 15:00 (EET Finnish time) .
   

  

 For information about the recruitment process, you’re welcome to contact Maria Nordin, HR Manager, phone: +46 60165590.
   

  

 Please fill out our electronic application form with your CV as soon as possible, but no later than
 **October 20th, 2024** 
 .
   

  

 Join us at Valmet, where your work contributes directly to a more sustainable future. Apply now and be a part of our journey forward towards innovation and excellence!
   

  

***When everything works together***
*Valmet is where the best talent from a wide variety of backgrounds comes together. With more than 19,000 professionals around the world, we are the leading global developer and supplier of technologies, automation and services for the pulp, paper and energy industries, and serve an even wider base of process industries with our automation systems and flow control solutions. Our commitment to moving our customers’ performance forward requires creativity, technological innovations, service know-how – and above all, teamwork.*
***Join the team!***
***www.valmet.com/careers***

title: Produktionspersonal till färgfabriken i Bellö, Eksjö kommun
description:
**Job Description**
**Om jobbet**
 För oss på Sherwin-Williams är det viktigt att arbeta säkert och ha en god arbetsmiljö, där vi värnar om varandra och hjälps åt.
   

  

 Arbetet består i huvudsak av tillverkning och fyllning av ytbehandlingsprodukter, där du arbetar självständigt utifrån skriftliga instruktioner tillsammans med övriga i ditt team. Eftersom det förekommer en del tunga lyft, är det viktigt att du har en normal fysisk förmåga. Arbetet är förlagt på kontinuerligt två-skift.
   

  

 Som person är du arbetsvillig, noggrann och kvalitetsmedveten. Har du erfarenhet från industriarbete är det meriterande.
   

  

 Du behöver ha körkort och tillgång till bil för att kunna ta dig till och från jobbet, samt gärna truck- och/eller traverskort.
   

  

 Anställningen är en visstidsanställning t o m 31 augusti 2024.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Krav:**
* Svenska i tal och skrift
* B-körkort


**Meriterande:**
* Truckkort
* Traverskort


**Sista ansökningsdag är 24 mars 2024.** 
 Urval sker löpande och tjänsterna kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

**About Us**
 Here, we believe there’s not one path to success, we believe in careers that grow with you. Whoever you are or wherever you come from in the world, there’s a place for you at Sherwin-Williams. We provide you with the opportunity to explore your curiosity and drive us forward. We’ll give you the space to share your strengths and we want you to show us what you can do. You can innovate, grow and discover in a place where you can thrive!
   

  

 Eligibility to Work
   

  

 You will need to provide proof of right to work. It is a condition of any offer of employment we make to you that you have the permission to work in the country for the role for which you are applying for.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer
   

  

 An equal opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on race, colour, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnic or national origin, disability, age pregnancy or maternity, marital or civil partner status, or any other protected characteristic prohibited by law.
   

  

 Please be aware, Sherwin-Williams recruiting team members will never request a candidate to provide a payment, ask for financial information, or sensitive personal information like national identification numbers, date of birth, or bank account numbers during the application process.

title: Kundansvarig projektledare till Dentsu Creative
description:
**Job Description:**
**Vi söker en affärsdriven Client Director till Dentsu Creative – en globalt prisbelönt byrå med ett spännande och integrerat erbjudande.**
  

  

**OM TJÄNSTEN** 
  

  

 Som Client Director har du det yttersta ansvaret för våra kunders tillväxt och utveckling. Ta del av vår starka kundportfölj och få även chans att vinna nya affärer till byrån. I rollen har du ambitiösa budgetmål, både för befintliga kunder och new business. Tack vare våra samarbeten inom dentsu-huset finns ett stort kontaktnät med starka kundrelationer att bygga vidare på.
   

  

 Du arbetar tillsammans med ett team av strateger, kreatörer, specialister, projektledare och produktionsledare. Tillsammans driver ni kampanjer, strategier och olika typer av kreativa kommunikationslösningar. Du bör vara mångsidig och van vid att driva olika typer av projekt, team och kunder. Du har goda projektledaregenskaper och värdesätter nära samarbete med såväl kund som kollegor. Du agerar rådgivare för dina kunder men utvecklar och inspirerar även dina kollegor.
   

  

 Du driver pitcher, proaktiva nykundsprojekt, offertförfrågningar och upphandlingar. Du verkar även för integrerade affärsmöjligheter med våra andra dentsu Service Lines, CXM och Media. Beroende på tidigare erfarenhet och intressen kan en del affärsutvecklingsansvar innefattas i rollen.
   

  

 Du tillhör ett av våra Business Teams, där vi växeldrar och hjälps åt med ett “Let’s do it”-mindset. Viktigt är att du är prestigelös och van att röra dig mellan en säljande roll, projektledare och ibland tom kan steppa in och stötta i mer operativa uppgifter. Du rapporterar till vår Business Director.
   

  

**I rollen kommer du att:** 
  

  

* Ha löpande kundkontakt och ansvara för att leda ett antal kunder
* Driva kundteam i olika typer av projekt och processer
* Jobba löpande med lönsamhet och tillväxt mot satta budgetmål
* Driva pitcher och proaktiva införsäljningsprojekt för att nå satta nykundsmål
* Sätta kundplaner, projektplaner, samt driva och följa upp dessa både internt och externt
* Tillsammans med strateger, planners och kreatörer initiera strategier, konceptarbeten, kampanjer och olika typer av varumärkesstärkande lösningar
* Delta i utvalda interna growth- och businessforum
* Arbeta och rapportera i verktyg som Salesforce och Marathon
* Tillsammans med projekt- och/eller produktionsledare kvalitetssäkra leveranser
* Bevaka projektens och kundens totala lönsamhet
* Delta och engagera dig i Dentsu Creatives gemensamma aktiviteter


  

  

**VEM ÄR DU?** 
  

  

 Du har minst 8 års erfarenhet från byråsidan i liknande befattning, med god erfarenhet av kundansvar, senior projektledning och försäljning. Du drivs av affär, att ständigt utmanas och att växa genom att fördjupa din kompetens inom kreativ kommunikation.  Du ödmjuk, utåtriktad, nyfiken och helhetsfokuserad. Du är van att rådge kunder – och känner dig utmanad och motiverad av att, tillsammans med specialister, driva bred och mångsidig kommunikation. Du är noggrann, ansvarstagande och värdesätter goda relationer med såväl kunder som kollegor. Du räds inte för att ta tag i krävande situationer som kan uppstå när riktigt bra kommunikation skapas.
   

  

 Sammanfattningsvis söker vi dig om har:
   

  

* Minst 8 års erfarenhet av senior projektledning och kundansvar
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av kundansvar, budgetansvar och försäljning
* Erfarenhet från byrå- eller konsultsidan
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med olika typer av kommunikationsdiscipliner


  

  

**OM DENTSU CREATIVE & DENTSU** 
  

  

 Dentsu Creative är en sammanslagning av de tidigare byråerna Isobar, John Brown och MKTG – och är nu en kreativ byrå i ett globalt nätverk. Vi tror att kreativ kommunikation har möjligheten påverka samhällen, bygga kultur och forma framtiden. Vi sätter lika stort värde på kreativt tänkande som digital förståelse och lösningar som skapar affärsnytta. På Dentsu Creative skapar vi varumärkesplattformar, reklam och sociala medie-kampanjer – men även content, PR-aktiveringar och event. I Sverige har vi siktet inställt på att bli en av branschens ledande kreativa byråer.
   

  

 På Dentsu Creative har du kollegor över hela världen. Totalt är vi cirka 9 000 personer på 145 marknader. Dentsu som globalt media- och kommunikationsnätverk har hela 47 000 medarbetare och erbjuder tjänster inom Media, Creative och CXM via våra ledande byråer Carat, dentsuX, iProspect, Dentsu Creative och Merkle.
   

  

 Som arbetsgivare erbjuder dentsu bland annat:
   

  

* Kollektivavtal
* 5000 kronor i friskvårdsbidrag
* 30 dagars semesterrätt
* Flexibilitet och en mix av hemarbete och en motiverande kontorsmiljö på central adress
* Stora karriärs- och utvecklingsmöjligheter


  

  

**Ansökan och kontakt** 
  

  

 Har du erfarenhet från liknande roll, är dedikerad i ditt sätt att växa affär och tycker att Dentsu Creative och dentsu låter spännande? Sök nu!
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en tillsvidareanställning med 6 månaders inledande provanställning. Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm. Vi kommer att påbörja urvalsprocessen i mitten av september, så sök gärna snarast möjligt.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Vid frågor, kontakta:
   

  

 Maria K. Cederbrand, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner
   

  

 maria.cederbrand@dentsu.com
   

  

**Location:**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Brand:**
 Dentsu Creative
   

  

**Time Type:**
 Full time
   

  

**Contract Type:**
 Permanent

title: ASIC verifier to global IT company
description:
Are you ready to shape the future of mobile technology? Join a dynamic team that is pushing the boundaries of 5G and 6G innovation, working on cutting-edge ASIC IPs in a collaborative and forward-thinking environment. With access to modern tools and methodologies, you’ll be empowered to drive real change and contribute to world-class solutions in next-generation connectivity. If you are an expert in ASIC IP verification and UVM, and eager to make a lasting impact in the telecommunications world - let's have a chat!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 Immediate or by agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 Our client is a leader in developing IPs that are critical for Digital ASICs, which support current and future mobile technology. They focus on using cutting-edge tools, technologies, and processes to keep up with industry standards and set new ones.
 


  


 Our client is looking for an experienced engineer with expertise in ASIC IP verification and knowledge in UVM to help push the boundaries of telecommunications. In this position, you will play a crucial role in driving innovation for 5G and 6G technologies.
 


  


 This is a consultant assignment, which means you will be hired by Academic Work and work as a consultant at the company in question. This is a long term assignment.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* Work with advanced ASIC tasks at the core of innovative chip development.
  
* Be part of a large, cutting-edge team focused on creating the most sophisticated chips on the market.
  
* Utilize modern, state-of-the-art technology within a company that leads the industry in tech innovation.
  
* Enjoy opportunities for continuous professional growth and development.
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Create detailed verification plans, covering all necessary specifications.
  
* Design, refine, and manage complex verification environments.
  
* Leverage and improve existing verification components.
  
* Apply both directed and random testing approaches to ensure thorough verification.
  
* Use advanced coverage techniques to guarantee complete verification.
  
* Lead ongoing efforts to enhance product quality and streamline processes, while promoting growth in technical expertise.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* A bachelor's or master's degree in Engineering Physics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Embedded Systems.
  
* Work life experience within ASIC
  
* Experience working with UVM
  
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written.
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Strong interest in technology and have outstanding interest in learning new things every day and wish to make a difference
  
* Problem-solving skills
  
* Proactive and able to take initiative
  
* Self-driven and independent
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Erik Örtegren or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth4@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15107004

title: Servertekniker (fokus lagring och backup) till Teracom
description:
Nu har du möjlighet att bidra till vidareutvecklingen av samhällskritisk infrastruktur i en verksamhet där varje sekund gör skillnad. Teracom Samhällsnät söker en
 **servertekniker** 
**med** 
**fokus på lagring- och backuplösningar** 
 . Var med och gör Sverige tryggare där det behövs, när det behövs.
   

  

 Teracom Samhällsnät levererar ett brett och specialiserat utbud av kommunikationstjänster med fokus på säkerhet, robusthet och yttäckning inklusive ansvar för utsändning av tv och radio samt VMA (Viktigt Meddelande till Allmänheten) över marknätet och drift av Rakel det digitala radiokommunikationssystem som används av bland annat polis, räddningstjänst, sjukvård och försvarsmakt.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vi söker dig som vill arbeta i en samhällsviktig verksamhet med höga krav på tillgänglighet, säkerhet och robusthet. Du erbjuds en mycket formbar roll där du har alla möjligheter att bidra till de tekniska valen och göra avtryck på framtidens IT-infrastruktur.
   

  

 Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Utveckling och livscykelhantering av Teracoms plattformar med särskilt fokus på lagring- och backuplösningar (NetApp) men även Linux, VMware och övriga infrarelaterade system
* Arbete med att upprätthålla funktion och drift varvat med automatisering, vidareutveckling och framtagning av nya plattformar och tekniker
* Hantera alltifrån installation och övervakning till driftsättning, felsökning, konfigurering och optimering av tekniska miljöer, med stort fokus på säkerhet (störst fokus är driftmiljö on-prem, i egna datahallar)
* Medverka i pågående och kommande förändrings- och utvecklingsprojekt där du bidrar med ditt kompetensområde, exempelvis i utformning av framtidens IT-infrastruktur
* Omvärldsbevaka och vara delaktig i att driva tekniken framåt


 Du kommer vara del av avdelningen IT Infrastruktur, bestående av erfarna, engagerade och samarbetsorienterade kollegor.
   

  

 Placeringsort är Stockholm, med en hybrid arbetsmodell.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
 Vi söker dig som har några års aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet inom lagrings- och backuplösningar (NetApp) samt inom Linux och VMware.
   

  

 Meriterande är erfarenhet inom IT-säkerhet samt av samhälls- och/eller verksamhetskritiska system, liksom relevant eftergymnasial utbildning.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. För att trivas och vara framgångsrik i rollen ser vi att du bör vara prestigelös, hjälpsam och ha god samarbetsförmåga. Vidare trivs du bra med komplex problemlösning och har en god förmåga att finna lösningar och nå resultat. Du är nyfiken och initativtagande.
   

  

**Övrig** 
**information**
 För anställning krävs att godkänd drog- och alkoholtest genomförs och att godkänd bakgrundskontroll liksom godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll genomförs, detta eftersom anställningen innefattar säkerhetsklassning. Med anledning av detta krävs även svenskt alternativt nordiskt medborgarskap.
   

  

**Anställningsform:** 
 Tillsvidaretjänst
   

  

**Beredskap:** 
 Valbart
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm (Lindhagensgatan 122) (hybrid arbetsmodell)
   

  

**Intresserad av att ansöka eller få veta mer?**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Teracom Samhällsnät med IDG Recruitment. Vid intresse eller frågor kontakta Alexandra Tihinen, Rekryteringskonsult på 070-447 92 24, alexandra.tihinen@foundryco.com.
   

  

 För att ansöka, vänligen skicka in ditt CV eller ansök med Linkedin.
   

  

**Om** 
**Teracom**
*Ett land ska leva överallt, oavsett – i glesbygd eller i storstad, vid kriser och omvälvande händelser. Det är just därför Teracom Samhällsnät finns.*
*Teracom Samhällsnät bidrar till ett tryggare samhälle genom att våra tjänster ser till att information och kommunikation kan fungera för de allra viktigaste samhällsfunktionerna även i kris och krig. Våra uppdrag inkluderar utsändningen av public servicekanalerna för radio och tv, beredskapsuppdraget Viktigt Meddelande till Allmänheten och ansvaret för kommunikationssystemet Rakel (det svenska blåljusnätet). Vi utvecklar och levererar också allt fler beredskapstjänster samt olika typer av kommunikationslösningar till totalförsvarsviktiga aktörer. Vi är ett statligt bolag och i Sverige är vi ca 500 medarbetare som finns på ca 50 orter i landet. Vår vision är att vi, i samarbete med våra uppdragsgivare, ska göra Sverige tryggare där det behövs, när det behövs. Läs mer hos Teracom.*

title: Tester with Lumera experience
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a
 **Tester** 
 🚀
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**
**About VIPAS :**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description:**
 As a
 **Test Designer/Automator** 
 , you will collaborate closely with the business to develop and write regression test scenarios that validate key flows and processes within Lumera.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop new test scenarios for critical business flows.
* Automate tests using Lumera Test Library.
* Monitor and report test results to ensure accuracy and efficiency.


**Requirements:**
* Proven experience in developing regression tests for Lumera.
* Hands-on experience with test automation in Lumera.
* Familiarity with the Lumera Test Library and its functionality
* Fluency in Swedish is required.


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at priyanka@vipas.se &contact me at +46727749222
   

  

 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How to Apply:**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Nätverkstekniker som är redo för nästa steg? Se hit!
description:
Nu söker vi en nätverkstekniker till ett uppdrag hos en av de ledande leverantörerna av molnbaserade IT-tjänster i Norden. Företaget arbetar med den senaste tekniken och du kommer ha enorma möjligheter att utvecklas och själv få forma din framtid. Du kommer att bli en del av företaget som bidrar till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för kunderna.
 



  





 Tjänsten inleds som konsultuppdrag med ambitionen att anställningen ska gå över till kunden.
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du självklart en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 I rollen som nätverkstekniker kommer du att vara en del av Operationsteamet. Tillsammans med dina kollegor i teamet kommer ni att ansvara för support, felsökning och incidenthantering av företagets nät, kommunikations- och säkerhetstjänster för kunderna.
 



  





 Du kommer att arbeta huvudsakligen med förändringar och felavhjälpning och få arbeta med Fortinet, Cisco och fysiska datacenter. Du kommer att få möjligheten att utveckla dina tekniska kunskaper inom bland annad routing, switchning, brandväggsfiltrering, VPN-tunnlar, VPN-klienter, trådlösa nätverk och WAN förbindelser.
 



  





 Du kommer att få arbeta i ett riktigt härligt team av kollegor som stöttar och utvecklar varandra.
 



 Beredskap och jour kan förekomma i tjänsten.
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




 Vi ser gärna att du har 1-3 års erfarenhet som nätverkstekniker och är redo för nästa steg. Vi värdesätter din förmåga och vilja att utvecklas och att du har ett brinnande intresse för teknik. Du har även kunskap inom routing, switchning, nätverkssäkerhet och brandväggar.
 



  





*Krav* 



* Praktiskt erfarenhet av brandväggen Checkpoint
* TCP/IP
* VPN
* BGP



  





*Meriterande* 



* Cisco
* Fortinet



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar.
 



  





*Mer om oss* 




 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Linköping och Örebro. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: IT Project Manager
description:
Vi söker en Senior IT Projektledare som ska leda, utveckla och driva resultat framåt mot vårt mål Störst på riktigt. Det här är en strategisk och operativ roll där du b.la kommer driva större och komplexare projekt, koordinera och arbeta nära ATG ITs teknikområden samt koordinera initiativ för flera avdelningar. Vidare kommer du säkerställa och driva att alla arbetar enligt kravställning och levererar enligt plan.
   

  

**I rollen får du:**
* Projektleda en mycket framåtlutad IT Produktorganisation
* Stor möjlighet till inflytande och påverkan
* Ansvara för End-to-End initiativ och projekt
* Hålla samman och koordinera alla delar avseende framdrift och leveranspunkter
* Bygga förtroende, rapportera och kommunicera med intressenter på alla nivåer
* Fungera som mentor inom projektledar-skråt samt för våra mindre seniora projektledare


**Är det här du?**
