title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
*The world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service is looking for a* ***Senior Analytics Engineer*** *to join the band in a consultant assignment. The client has transformed music listening forever when launched in 2008.*

***Period:*** *2024-11-04 to 2025-05-04 (full-time), with a possibility of extension.*

#### **About the role**


User Platform (UP) is a studio in client’s Platform mission. The Platform mission is responsible for building the tooling and support platforms for the engineering teams at the company. UP owns the platforms for authentication, authorization, user account data, and user experience configuration at the company. UP was formed with the mission to provide a secure platform that helps users establish their identities and manage their account data on different surfaces. UP also enables teams around the client to experiment on and customize the user experience in new and more refined ways. User Platform is responsible for many of the core services needed for our client to function and provide 380M+ users across the world access to the audio experience they desire.  

  

During this assignment we want to enable anyone at the client, including the UP studio, to understand users’ identity and access patterns effectively, to form better experiences within user acquisition and retention, strengthen account security as well as improve the global client product decision making. Achieving this requires a significant investment in enhancing our IAM data health and structure.  

  

We are looking for a talented, engaged senior analytics engineer to help our client's teams working on large and highly available data sets that form the backbone of our product experience for hundreds of millions of users across the globe.

#### **What you'll do**

* Define IAM Domain Data Schema
* Propose the most efficient and scalable data schemas tailored to the needs of the IAM domain. This involves understanding the current IAM systems, identifying gaps, and proposing improvements in the data structure
* Establish Data Governance and Ownership
* Set clear roles and responsibilities for data management, define data quality metrics, and ensure compliance with internal and external data policies. Create comprehensive documentation outlining best practices for data modeling specific to the IAM domain
* Collaborate with Engineering Teams on Event Instrumentation
* Work closely with the engineering teams to set instrumentation requirements and to ensure the collected data is accurate and actionable
* Lead Project Planning and Execution
* Break down the overall project into manageable tasks and phases. Lead the planning and execution efforts, ensuring that all tasks are completed on time and meet the defined objectives

#### **Who you are**

* You have 5+ years of experience in the development of data products (using Python, SQL)
* You have a track record of taking open-ended analytics goals and translating them into production-quality datasets
* You are comfortable stepping through ETL processes and tracing data flows through complex DAGs and you are experienced with DBT
* You are knowledgeable in data modeling, data access and data storage techniques
* You have strong proficiency using SQL in cloud data warehouses (e.g. BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake) and are comfortable with performance optimization, data partitioning, and window functions
* Experience with GCP tooling is a plus
* You are a communicative person who values building strong relationships with colleagues and partners and enjoys mentoring and teaching others
* You are able to operate effectively and autonomously across multiple teams in situations of ambiguity, with only high-level direction
* Improve data quality through testing, tooling and continuously evaluating performance

#### **We are Market Partner**

*Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, no matter where you come from, or what you look like.*

title: Machine Learning Specialist
description:
*The world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service is looking for a* ***Machine Learning Specialist*** *to join the band in a consultant assignment. The client has transformed music listening forever when launched in 2008.*

***Period:*** *ASAP to 2025-11-25 (full-time), with a possibility of extension.*

#### **About the role**


The Machine Learning product area in the Activation, Retention, Conversion studio are focused on building robust and scalable machine learning solutions that can personalize activation, retention and conversion funnels to improve important business metrics like SUBS and MAU.  

  

Through our client's messaging platform as well as other discovery & conversion surfaces, they communicate with users to connect them with valuable audio content and to help the business grow.  

  

The client's vision is to build the machine learning models and infrastructure that offers a fully personalized and ML-optimized experience for listeners throughout their user journey that powers every messaging and conversion campaign.  

  

This role sits in a squad called White Mouse that owns the optimization of plan upsell targeting across the company. The key problem areas are: What plan should the user be upsold on discovery surfaces? How should we communicate the user on consideration surfaces? How should we balance upselling plans vs other paid products? They are also working on projects around ad load optimization.  

  

**What you’ll do**  

  

* Contribute to designing, building, evaluating, shipping, and refining the company’s product by hands-on ML development
* Collaborate with a multi-functional agile team spanning user research, design, data science, product management, and engineering to build new product features that advance the clinet's mission to connect artists and fans in personalized and relevant ways
* Prototype new approaches and productionize solutions at scale for the client's hundreds of millions of active users
* Help drive optimisation, testing, and tooling to improve quality
* Be part of an active group of machine learning practitioners in your mission and across the company

  

**Who you are**  

-You have a strong background in machine learning, theory, and practice -You are comfortable explaining the intuition and assumptions behind ML concepts  

* You have hands-on experience implementing and maintaining production ML systems in Python, Scala, or similar languages
* Experience with TensorFlow is also a plus
* You are experienced with building data pipelines, and you are self-sufficient in getting the data you need to build and evaluate your models
* You preferably have experience with cloud platforms like GCP or AWS
* You care about agile software processes, data development, reliability, and focused experimentation
* You have a desire to drive business impact

  

**Where you'll be**  

This role will be located in Stockholm City
#### **We are Market Partner**

*Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, no matter where you come from, or what you look like.*

title: Test Engineer
description:
We are looking for a **Test Engineer** for a Global Automotive Company based in Gothenburg.

**The team:**


Is developing a centralized diagnostic platform for the next-generation vehicles. This platform enables to collect diagnostics from every corner of the vehicle, store it alongside relevant data (e.g., snapshots), and transmit it to the cloud for advanced analysis.


As a Test Engineer you will be responsible for designing, implementing and executing test cases to validate the functionality and performance of software components. You will collaborate with software developers, system architects, and other testers to ensure the reliability and robustness of the system.


**Expertise in:**

* Experience with test case design, test script development, and test automation.
* Hands-on experience with system-level integration and end-to-end validation
* Experience with test automation frameworks and tools (e.g., Python, Robot Framework, Jenkins).
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and continuous testing.


Valid European driver’s license B is must because you will be testing and driving vehicles.


Degree in computer science or electrical engineering preferred.

**Big advantage if you know:**

* C++ experience, big plus
* Knowledge of automotive operating systems (e.g., AUTOSAR, QNX, Linux).
* Familiarity with diagnostic protocols (e.g., UDS, OBD-II) and data logging tools.
* Hands-on experience with hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) or software-in-the-loop (SIL) testing environments.

**Who you are:**


You are adaptable, possess excellent communication and documentation skills, maintain a positive attitude, and are supportive and team oriented. You have a passion and an interest for the profession of being a Test Engineer.


Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.


If you are curious and willing to develop, this opportunity is made for you. You will have room to bring process and tool improvements forward, developing both you and the organization.


This is a full-time consultancy position through Incluso in Gothenburg. Start is in November, one year limited contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.


For more information, please contact Kanika Singhal, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Seize Your Summer! Intern with Europe's leading cloud...
description:
Imagine spending your summer collaborating with some of the brightest minds in the tech industry, where your ideas are welcomed and encouraged. The Visma summer internship program is your ticket to gaining hands-on experience, shaping future technologies, and setting the stage for a meaningful career in tech.

### **About us**


Visma is a collective of nearly 200 companies spread across 33 countries. Together we’re on a mission to improve the work-life of millions of people worldwide by developing and delivering software that simplifies complex processes.  

  

What's the best part? When you work at Visma, you get the best of both worlds: the feeling of a local startup with the perks of belonging to Europe's leading software company.  

  

**What you can expect**  

Based on your background and preferences, you’ll join one of our companies to work on a project in key areas such as Software Engineering, AI development, and Business development. From day one, you’ll be an essential member of your assigned team, contributing to strategically important projects to drive our company forward. You'll gain an inside look at how advanced technology solves real business problems and creates significant value for society.  

  

You excel at seizing opportunities by taking on challenging projects related to our core products, including refining business models, optimizing product packaging, analyzing complex datasets, and participating in M&A activities. Additionally, you thrive in optimizing and streamlining internal processes, consistently seeking ways to boost efficiency and effectiveness.

### **Who we’re looking for**


As a Summer Intern, you’re a third or fourth-year student eager to dive into real-world experience at one of Europe’s largest software companies. You are currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Informatics, AI, Business Administration or similar. You have a commercial mindset and are eager to join us on our mission to improve the work-life of millions of people around the world with our software.  

  

You’re a critical thinker who excels at solving complex challenges, asking insightful questions, and challenging the status quo. Whether you have a passion for coding and innovation or aspire to lead future tech projects, you’re a self-starter who thrives both independently and as part of a team. Plus, you have strong communication skills in both written and verbal Swedish and English.  

  

**Internship details**  

  

The internship runs from the middle of June until the first week of August 2025. You’ll have two weeks off in July for the holiday break.

*This programme is international, so for the first week, all interns from Denmark, Finland, Norway, and Sweden will be together in Oslo. This will give you a chance to get to know each other and Visma, meet your colleagues, and participate in both informational courses and fun social activities! After that first week, you’ll start your project period in your home country.*


During your internship, you’ll work with real projects, so the goal is for us to continue your work after the summer is over. You’ll work in international teams and be given a high level of responsibility, while being supported by experienced colleagues. We’ll do our best to put you on a project that aligns with your competence and interests.

### **Why choose Visma?**


At Visma, we go beyond competitive terms and employee benefits. Here’s what makes us stand out.


We invest in your development. Personal and career growth are priorities here. With support from a personal mentor, former trainees, and a dedicated program leader, you'll build a solid network to rely on for guidance and development.


Experience a variety of responsibilities. One of the biggest advantages of working in Visma? We’re a network of companies, each with their own products and projects. You’ll have the opportunity to experience different responsibilities through different projects, allowing you to discover in which roles you excel.


We’re more than just colleagues. Enjoy a warm, social work culture with social activities for anyone. We invite you to a cabin trip together with the other interns, so you can all get to know each other really well and share some good memories. Your buddies will also make sure you have a blast, with fun activities planned after work!  

  

Your ideas drive us forward. We value unique insights and creativity and are not afraid of taking risks – that’s how we learn. We'll trust you to experiment, learn, and grow just as much.

### **Application process**


Instead of a traditional cover letter, we want to know: Why do you want to spend your summer as an intern in Visma, and what are the key strengths you'll bring to the programme? Share your thoughts in a paragraph or two, approximately 100-150 words. Don't forget to upload your CV and higher education grade reports; screenshots of grades are okay if official reports aren't available.


We will review applications continuously so we highly recommend you to apply as soon as possible. All applicants will receive feedback from us after the deadline. Keep an eye on your spam folder, just in case!


Once you apply, get ready to complete some ability tests. If we think we are a great match, we'll invite you to a digital interview. The final interview, including a case study, will take place at our office in Stockholm.

**Remember to apply before the deadline, November 24th 2024, 12 PM - we can't wait to hear from you!**

  




**Do you want to know more about career opportunities?** Check out our career site.

title: Receptionist till natt-teamet - vikariat på heltid
description:
**Från hjärtat av Göteborg erbjuder Svenska Mässan Gothia Towers allt från stora mässor och event till oförglömliga hotell- och restaurangupplevelser. Vår verksamhet innefattar många starka varumärken som tillsammans skapar en unik och attraktiv mötesplats där vi varje år välkomnar nästan två miljoner besökare. Som medarbetare hos oss jobbar du tillsammans med ett stort, engagerat och sammansvetsat gäng och är med och utvecklar vår verksamhet, både nu och för framtiden.**

**Om rollen**  

I tjänsten som nattreceptionist arbetar du både med sedvanliga arbetsuppgifter så som in- och utcheckning, parkering av gästers bilar samt telefonväxel samt andra administrativa uppgifter så som data-backuper, fakturahantering och viss redovisning.


På natten förbereder du bl.a. för dagens ankommande gäster, ställer fram tidig "expressfrukost" och förutom receptionist är du även hotellets Guest Service, Housekeeping och allt-i-allo, man gör helt enkelt det som behöver göras för att gästerna skall få en så bra vistelse som möjligt.


Tillsammans med hotellets säkerhetsvakt så säkerställer du och dina kollegor i nattreceptionsteamet att hotellet nattetid är en säker plats att vistas på för alla gäster, man patrullerar i hotellobbyn med jämna mellanrum för att ha kontroll på vilka som vistas där och varför.

 **Varför ska du välja oss?**  

Vi på Svenska Mässan Gothia Towers är ett stort och sammansvetsat team med positiva och sociala kollegor. Med mycket glädje, mod och engagemang jobbar vi tätt ihop för att ge den bästa helhetsupplevelsen till våra miljontals besökare. Varje dag. Året om. Det är roligt att gå till jobbet eftersom vi får bidra till att skapa den mest attraktiva mötesplatsen i Europa. I vår dynamiska verksamhet finns mycket erfarenhet och kunskap inom olika yrkesområden. Eftersom vi har så många olika verksamheter finns ett stort antal möjligheter som kan sträcka sig över en hel karriär.

 **Vem är du?**  

Vi söker dig som har ett högt engagemang, strukturerad och noggrann. Du har ett lösningsorienterat synsätt och kan ta tag i arbetsuppgifter där det behövs. För att trivas i rollen behöver man ha ett stort intresse för människor och en passion för service. Som person trivs du med att jobba i team och ha lätt för att samarbeta både med gäster, kollegor och andra avdelningar i huset.


Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet från servicebranschen och gärna att du tidigare arbetat i reception eller liknande. Tidigare erfarenhet från nattarbete samt kunskaper i hotellsystemet Opera Cloud är meriterande. Du bör även ha goda kunskaper i engelska i tal och skrift. Körkort B (manuell växel) är ett krav och man skall känna sig bekväm med att köra våra gästers bilar.

 **Information om tjänsten**  

Arbetstiderna är förlagda till kl. 22:30-07:30, mån-mån. Man jobbar varannan vecka och är ledig varannan vecka. Nattetid är man vanligtvis tre receptionister i receptionen (varav en är arbetsledare, s k Supervisor) och man ansvarar för både Gothia Towers och Upper House.


Vi tillämpar kollektivavtal Visita/HRF tillsammans med ett lokalt nattavtal för våra nattreceptionister.


Denna anställningen är ett studievikariat med god chans till förlängning.

 **Information om tjänsten**  

Vid frågor om tjänsten vänligen kontakta Lovisa Svan, Front Office Manager, via mail lovisa.svan@gothiatowers.com eller tel 031-750 88 09.

 **Välkommen med din ansökan!**

  

Bli en del av vår värld – det är här vi skapar upplevelser för livet. Läs mer om oss på www.svenskamassan.se och www.gothiatowers.com.  

*Inom Svenska Mässan Gothia Towers strävar vi efter en mångfald hos våra medarbetare och vi arbetar aktivt för att främja en inkluderande kultur. Våra kärnvärden - engagemang, samarbete och mod - är grunden för vår verksamhet och genomsyrar allt vi gör både internt och externt.*

title: Head of eCommerce
description:
**ABOUT THE COMPANY**

*Tiger of Sweden is a Stockholm-based fashion house established in 1903 with a heritage in tailoring. For more than a century Tiger of Sweden has stood for style with purpose, dressing men and women for whom true style is about the confidence to be themselves.*

**POSITION OVERVIEW:**

  

The Head of eCommerce holds full strategic and operational responsibility for the eCommerce business, including full ownership of its P&L. Success in this role requires a deep understanding of the entire eCommerce value chain, combining strong commercial acumen and analytical skills with creative thinking to enhance the premium brand positioning of Tiger of Sweden. A key focus will be driving a robust technical roadmap, prioritizing site optimization, conversion rate improvements, and seamless customer experiences across all digital touchpoints.


In addition to managing financial performance, the role demands leadership in customer acquisition and retention strategies, leveraging data-driven marketing, personalized retention programs, and innovative approaches to boost growth and customer lifetime value. As a partner and trusted advisor to the CEO, the Head of eCommerce will play a pivotal role in driving the brand’s digital strategy, aligning it with broader business growth objectives, and ensuring the continuous digital development of the brand.

 **TASKS & RESPONSIBILITIES:**

  

* Lead, develop and mentor a cross functional digital team, ensuring seamless collaboration through operations, paid media, SEO, retention and onside development to achieve unified business goals.
* Drive the development and execution of a cohesive, integrated digital strategy, focusing on a fully optimized, digital first approach to create and exceptional and efficient online platform.
* Define, refine and optimize email marketing campaigns and customer loyalty programs, with a focus on increasing customer lifetime value through retention strategies and personalize communications.
* Take full ownership and responsibility for the digital P&L, ensuring the achievement of annual sales and profit targets, and maintaining financial accountability for the financial performance of the digital team.
* Contribute to shaping the global brand strategy by proposing and implementing innovative initiatives and priorities that align with the broader organizational goals.
* Leverage data to continuously monitor and improve key business metrics, making data driven decisions to boost overall performance.
* Oversee the entire product life cycle on site, from inception through to the final sale ensuring a smooth and effective process for product management, merchandising and customer engagement.
* Collaborate closely with the marketing team to ensure that all online outreach initiatives are optimized for maximum reach and effectiveness, from social media campaigns to digital advertising.
* Analyze, manipulate and present complex data in clear, actionable formats for the senior management team, providing insights to guide decision making.
* Continuously identify and lead opportunities to enhance CRO, using data and user insights to improve overall net sales across 73 global markets.
* Successfully liaise with the internal and external tech teams to ensure that system upgrades and functionality changes are delivered as required, in budget and within minimum disruption for customers
* Work in close collaboration with other business functions to create a smooth, multi-channel experience for customers

**SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS:**

* 8-10 years’ experience in eCommerce
* Proven track record in eCommerce management roles, with leadership skills to motivate and manage a diverse team.
* Track record of successfully driving P&L growth and delivering against plan
* Strong understanding of all relevant eCommerce best practices, processes and KPIs
* Technical minded with a strong interest in digital technology and ecommerce trends
* Strong understanding of the digital marketing ecosystem driving customer acquisition and retention
* Able to use data and insight to create and inspire innovation and growth
* Strong communication skills, oral and written in English
* Well-structured with the ability to shift from detailed to holistic perspective
* Ambitious entrepreneurial mindset, yet pragmatic and solution-oriented
* Positive with high energy and passionate about customer experience
* Well-structured with the ability to shift from detailed to holistic perspective

**TOOLS & SYSTEMS**

* Salesforce Commerce Cloud suite
* Email Marketing Software such as Voyado, MailChimp, SF Marketing Cloud
* Acute knowledge on CMS tools such as page designer, Content Square etc
* Knowledge and understanding order management systems and payment gateways
* Proficient knowledge of all Microsoft Office
* Data visualization tools such as Tableau, BI

The position is based in *our Head office in Stockhol*m and is a full-time position. *If this sounds like the perfect fit* for you? Please don't hesitate to apply by submitting a CV and personal letter in English.


We look forward to receiving your application.


Tiger of Sweden stands against any form of discrimination and strives to be an inclusive brand and workplace. We welcome applications from all individuals, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, race, or disability and recruitment is purely on the based on skills and experience.

title: Talent Acquisition/HR Intern
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters**  

Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.


We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.

**About the role**  

Are you passionate about identifying top talent and fostering a culture of growth and excellence? Do you want to get experience within the HR area alongside with your current studies? As our Talent Acquisition/HR Intern at Xensam, you will play a vital role in supporting our People & Culture team in sourcing, recruiting, and hiring the best talent, among other HR tasks and projects.


We are seeking several interns who are currently studying and interested in completing their internship with our company during spring 2025. This internship has the potential to transition into a part-time TA/HR Assistant role based on performance and business needs.

**Responsibilities**

* Assist the Talent Acquisition Specialist in their daily tasks, such as screening resumes, conducting initial screening calls and assessments to evaluate candidates' qualifications, experience, and cultural fit.
* Source and attract high-quality candidates through LinkedIn.
* Build and maintain a strong talent pipeline to meet current and future hiring needs.
* Support the People & Culture team with various HR-related tasks and projects as needed.
* Contribute to our Employer Branding initiatives.

**Qualifications:**

* Currently studying Human Resources, Business, or a related field.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with fluency in Swedish and proficiency in English.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, tech-driven environment.
* Highly engaged, with a proactive and results-oriented mindset.
* Strong organizational skills and a structured approach to recruitment and HR tasks.
* A positive attitude and willingness to learn and adapt.

**What we offer**

* An exciting opportunity to start your career within Human Resources and the chance to work alongside a passionate and supportive People & Culture team.
* 3 days in-office schedule (remote Mondays & Fridays)
* A generous work culture with free access to beverages & snacks, gym, bi-weekly massages at the office, shuffleboard, and other games etc.
* Work with a diverse group driven by ambition as well as having fun together with different activities
* Great opportunity to influence your career development as well as the company's
* Work with the latest technology in the fastest-growing SAM software in the market


At Xensam, our core values define our workplace atmosphere:

**REBELLIOUS** We foster a rebellious spirit, promoting freedom within responsibilities and encouraging initiative.

**HUMANE** Our team promotes a caring, inclusive environment where diversity is valued, and individuals are respected and empowered to be themselves.

**HARMONIOUS** We prioritize harmony, valuing work-life balance, and creating a pleasant atmosphere.


Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and caring workplace. If you're a team player eager to grow professionally, **APPLY now!**

title: Senior UI Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


We are looking for Senior SW UI Developers to join an exciting new initiative in Ericsson. We are launching an exciting SaaS initiative that aims to overhaul how we deliver solutions, using As-a-Service on public Hyper Cloud Providers (HCP) as our vehicle. Our goal is twofold: To thrill our customers by delivering services they love and giving them a competitive edge, while building a “lean and mean” product development organization that will allow Ericsson to scale at profit. You will be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You will be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

If you're passionate about fostering modern product development paradigms, inspiring change, shaping innovative technology to deliver customer value, and you get a kick about building something entirely new, we want you on board!

 **Why join Solution Area Sapper:**  

Ericsson Cloud Software & Services (BCSS) continues to evolve cloud-native portfolio as well as explores new ways of building solutions, including enabling cloud native “as-a-Service” offerings. The newly established Sapper unit will ensure BCSS readiness for “as-a-Service” when our customers start shifting towards new network operations models that could truly maximise the opportunities and agility cloud native deployment brings. We have chosen a less traditional name for our new acceleration unit to signal that this unit will operate differently. The name Sapper originates from a soldier who performs ambitious tasks that require engineering skills, a pioneer with deep technical understanding.  

  

With us, you will have an outstanding opportunity: The chance to use your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what is possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems.


Within this new area, we are building a number of teams and this particular job specification is for a position as part of the Management Plane Team. In this team we will have responsibility to design and develop the Network Management of this new ‘Core Network as a Service’ offering, and by that we mean functionality such as Life cycle management, Orchestration, Configuration Management, Performance Management, among others. So we aim to design and implement a truly global SaaS management suite with a best in class User interface to manage public cloud deployed Services and infrastructure.

 **Why join our team:**  

We are building a dream team, and this is what we are after…  

* Innovative atmosphere. Be part of a creative, forward-thinking team dedicated to revolutionizing the way we do software.
* Collaborative culture. Work alongside dedicated engineers who share your passion for technology and community building.
* Strong sense of purpose and high impact. Shape the future of our products and directly impact the experience of our customers and developers across our global company.
* Psychological safety. An environment where team members feel comfortable trying new things, voicing their ideas and admitting mistakes without fear of negative repercussions.
* Career growth. We invest in your development, offering opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
* Endless possibilities. Your ideas and innovations won’t just be heard – they’ll be the driving force behind our success.
**What you will do:**
---------------------


* Design and develop a truly global SaaS Management Plane to manage our ‘as a service’ offerings.
* Work in an agile team using Lean, Agile and DevSecOps methodologies and tooling
* Collaborate with other development teams to ensure our Management SW applications fit and function as part of the overall solution.
* Knowledge share to onboard new team members
* Stay up-to-date with industry standard methodologies and emerging technologies

 **The skills you bring:**

* Minimum of 5 years of UI SW application design and development
* Expertise in Javascript, HTML and CSS
* Experience of User Interface technologies and frameworks, knowledge of Tailwind and Javascript web frameworks such as Svelte (or similar) is an advantage
* Strong knowledge of User Experience techniques and methodologies
* Knowledge of Ericsson Branding and Ericsson Design System (EDS) best practices and recommendations is an advantage.
* Experience or knowledge of designing APIs (Sync and Async) such as REST, gRPC
* Experience or knowledge of secure design and secure coding (SAST) and DAST
* Experience developing applications in a public cloud such as GCP, AWS, Azure
* Cloud native tools and technologies: containers, Kubernetes
* Knowledge of DevSecOps and CICD and related tools
* Knowledge of Telecoms and in particular Network Management is an advantage
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Associate Partner
job_function: General Business, Management, and Business Development
description:
Stelltec was established at the end of 2022, with a vision to revolutionise the tech delivery industry. During 2023 they were able to grow the team to seven people and secure a number of key clients. To build on this success Stelltec is looking to add an additional associate partner to their company in 2024.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
* A senior management consultant with at least 10 years’ experience – coupled with a strong tech or IT delivery focus who has worked as a senior project or program manager.
* An excellent business developer, with a great network and reputation in the market.
* Proven track record of building client relationships and developing client accounts within Sweden.
* A strong leadership profile, someone who wants to be part of building Stelltec and our exciting growth journey.
* Someone who enjoys recruitment and be involved in attracting the best talent in the marketplace.


**What We Can Offer**
* An associate partner position, in a successful, early-stage consulting business.
* A mandate for growth and development.
* The autonomy to grow in the way you want, rather than in a heavily processed and hierarchal company.
* To work alongside a superb leadership group with an excellent market reputation.
* To be part of a group of consulting companies, gaining access to an innovative and collaborative ecosystem.


**Who Is Stelltec**
 Stelltec is a consulting company focused on IT delivery management, founded in 2022. We are building a team of experienced, delivery-focused IT consultants with the skills, know-how and passion for taking on our clients’ most challenging projects – maximizing the value of their IT investments.
   

  

 Our team brings vast experience, deep knowledge and thorough understanding of what it takes to drive software, platform and technology implementations to successful completion. Stelltec has the skills our clients need to gain momentum, drive business value and achieve great results by enabling their tech organization to succeed.
   

  

 We’ll make it stellar. Together.
   

  

 Whether Stelltec takes on a digital re-platforming, a cloud transformation project or the digitalization of key business processes, we make it happen in a timely, efficient and cost-effective way. Managing projects, initiatives or any delivery-focused workstreams is the heart of our business, and we are not afraid to take risks in order to prove our value.
   

  

**We Have Four Key Areas To Our Offering**
* Technical Project Management


 We create the right environment for our client projects, and then we keep our promise to deliver. We add proven delivery and execution power to their existing organization and setup.
   

  

* Technical transformation


 We shape the necessary tech initiatives to complete your business transformation. Then we drive its execution while making sure you realize the value we have identified.
   

  

* Turnaround


 We reverse the negative trend within initiatives where IT and tech are vital components. We work actively to identify and solve the issues holding our customer’s business back and help unlock fixed positions, e.g., with suppliers and systems integrators.
   

  

* Project due diligence


 We analyse projects either before or after they start. We can assess the project’s likelihood of success and suggest improvements to raise the probability or even help deliver the project.
   

  

 We are a consulting company focused on IT delivery management. We are a team of experienced, delivery-focused IT consultants with the skills, know-how and passion for taking on our clients’ most challenging projects – maximizing the value of their IT investments. Read more at www.stelltec.se

title: Senior Project Manager
description:

* The possibility to help create and shape a brand-new business.
* Opportunities to work on prestigious assignments with established Swedish and international companies, as well as start-ups.
* The chance to work with senior professionals from the IT consulting world as well as data consultants, management consultants and all aspects of the Newground Alliance.

title: Data Engineer
description:
We are Sinch. Join us and be a part of a global leader in Communication Platforms as a Service (CPaaS) and mobile customer engagement. With presence in more than 60 countries, we enable businesses to reach everyone in the world, through mobile messaging, email, voice, and video.
   

  

 We believe equal opportunities are the key to our success. No matter who you are, you'll be able to explore career options, face captivating challenges, and build skills alongside outstanding people.
   

  

****The essence of the role****
 Come be a part of our team as a Data Engineer. Take the lead in building, maintaining, and supporting data pipelines throughout our global product portfolio. Unleash your creativity and leverage the latest technologies to shine in this role. Your expertise in SQL, Python, and ETL/ELT will empower you to take a proactive approach to sophisticated challenges and shaping data pipelines that enhance the data domain and foster connectivity across Sinch.
   

  

 This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden, and functions under a hybrid model, reporting to the Data Engineering Manager.
   

  

**As Our Data Engineer, You Will**
* Implement high-impact initiatives in a rapidly growing business to drive results for our customers and the world.
* Engage in the integration of data across diverse platforms and products.
* Contribute to data pipelines development, performance, quality, monitoring, and maintenance.
* Identify opportunities for improvement in our data movement pipelines.
* Lead data engineering projects to ensure successful delivery.


****Who are you?****
 We believe you bring solid expertise in diverse data landscapes, coupled with proficiency in pipeline development and governance. Your essential experience with virtualization tools, as well as your demonstrated capability in real-time data processing and analytics sets you apart. As an effective communicator, you effortlessly bridge the technical and business sectors. Your dedication to continual learning ensures that you stay current of industry trends and eagerly adopt new technologies.
   

  

 To succeed in this role, we see that you have:
   

  

* Robust foundation in software development, including fluency in Python, Spark, Git, CI/CD, and Docker.
* Demonstrated experience using SQL for data querying and building ETL/ELT processes.
* Practical expertise with data lakes and data warehouses, implementing best practices to structure and store big volumes of datasets.
* Skilled in data pipeline creation and orchestration tools, such as Airflow and Dagster.
* Hands-on experience with Databricks and cloud platforms such as AWS or GCP.
* Fluency in English.


****Ready to chase your dreams?****
 Join our data-centric organization by submitting your application in English.
   

  

 Together, let's shape the future of data-driven innovation, where organizational data lies at the heart of what we do. Be a part of our global data team that promotes growth and embraces hybrid work arrangements.
   

  

 At Sinch, we value learning, adopt change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not able to support relocation outside EU at present, therefore, will take into consideration only applicants who hold a Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship, or have a valid work permit for Sweden.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
**Why join Bannerflow?** 




 Our mission is to accelerate creativity and collaboration for marketing teams, at scale and across channels. To deliver on this, we have defined five must-win battles that will guide us to success; People & Culture, Product-driven Revenue Growth, Successful International Expansion, Maintain & Grow our Commercial Journey, and Sustainable Tech Platform for the future.
 



 Bannerflow is a high-growth company and one of Europe's most exciting SaaS companies. We build a Creative Management Platform that allows enterprise brands to create, publish, analyze, and optimize advertising in-house, at scale. As part of the Bannerflow team, you will get the opportunity to work with a creative, enabling, and premium close-based architecture. Our creative management platform serves more than 6 billion ads each month, viewed on 500 million unique devices all over the world.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 We seek a dynamic and proactive Customer Success Manager (CSM) to join our team. In this role, you will manage a portfolio of approximately 35 enterprise customers within a specific market, ensuring successful onboarding, product adoption, and overall satisfaction with the Bannerflow marketing cloud platform. Your mission will include driving customer retention and revenue growth through strategic customer projects, quarterly business reviews, and maintaining high satisfaction levels.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Facilitate a smooth onboarding experience for new customers.
* Drive increased usage and engagement with the Bannerflow platform.
* Lead key customer projects, collaborating with stakeholders to deliver success.
* Conduct regular reviews to assess and enhance customer satisfaction.
* Maintain and improve satisfaction levels across your customer portfolio.
* Achieve revenue growth through retention and upsell initiatives.



  





**Skills And Competencies** 



* Proven ability to manage and complete customer projects effectively.
* Strong skills in building and maintaining relationships with customers.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Any additional language is a bonus.
* Ability to analyze and report on customer data to drive insights.
* Proficient in upselling and negotiating with customers.
* Demonstrates initiative to drive customer success.
* Prioritizes and meets the needs of customers.
* Effective in quickly resolving issues.
* Flexible and responsive to changing customer and business needs.
* Strong understanding of business principles to drive growth.
* Humble, grounded, and collaborative attitude.



  





**Why join us?** 




 We live alongside our values of Collaboration, Passion, and Challenge; with many events going on at Bannerflow such as Health Month, after works, inspiration sessions, workouts, and hackathons, there’s something for everyone.
 



 We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team and welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities.
 



 We offer a hybrid workplace and a competitive compensation package including pension according to ITP1, health allowance, parental leave top-up, and health care insurance.

title: Senior Solution Architect
description:
**Role:**
* Lead and manage our project from an architectural perspective, encompassing process improvements, enhanced controls, and technology integration across various aspects of the Source-to-Pay (S2P) processes.
* Implement strategic procurement solutions tailored to meet requirements, using best practices and guidance from our partners.
* Execute process improvements within procurement to enhance operational efficiency.
* Streamline systems and procedures to optimize procurement operations on a global scale.
* Bring procurement market dynamics and provide well-informed guidance to the project team.
* Provide guidance and patterns to ensure that the development team builds solutions that are scalable, flexible, secure, and aligned with the long-term strategy.


****Practical requirements:****
* Source-to-Pay (S2P) platforms preferably Coupa, however additional expertise with tools like Ivalua, Icertis, Zycus, SAP Ariba and SAP S4 as an implementer/administrator would be advantageous.
* Hands-on involvement in at least 1-2 end-to-end implementations, including Blueprint Workshops, with the ability to map business processes effectively.
* Experience in functional/implementation aspects of Coupa, or other E-procurement technologies, particularly focusing on areas such as Spend Analysis, Strategic Sourcing, Contract Management, Supplier Management, Procure, Invoicing, Expense, Pay, and eForms.
* Experience in formulating and implementing non-functional requirement including IT security
* Proficiency in defining data migration strategies for master and transactional data across upstream and downstream systems.
* Experience in working with large enterprises with complex IT solution landscape.


****Quliafications:****
* Experience with a focus on supply chain and operations.
* Used to work in high pace projects with ability to deliver on time.
* Ability to work with many stakeholders such as Product Owners, Tech Leads, Vendors and Third-party suppliers.
* Problem-solving abilities, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
* Willingness to some travel to other locations within Europe.

title: Solution Architect (Senior)
description:
We are looking for a Senior Solution Architect for our organization
   

  

* Take the lead on design work for new solutions supporting business initiatives requiring new functions and services.
* Develop, build, and manage the Network, transforming our legacy network to network as a code with a service layer.
* Control that architectural policies and guidelines are followed by a roadmap.
* Provide technical engineering, and best practices concerning the overall Network.
* Control that architectural policies and guidelines are followed and by the roadmap.
* Analyze, design, develop, and maintain roadmaps and implementation plans.
* Monitor performance, and ensure availability, and reliability.
* Documentation of service design package and service description.
* Documentation of guidelines, processes, and routines.
* Setting and maintaining network standards.
* Being an advisor in Network design, planning, building, and operating within the Network domain.
* Cooperate and coordinate with stakeholders’ contributions with Network knowledge to reach business needs.
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices, making recommendations as needed to help our company develop.
* Understand and visualize concepts that are not yet concrete, and use your problem-solving skills, strong analytic ability, creativity, and customer and business drive to find a solution.
* See the big picture, identify patterns, and instinctively know how to win support for your ideas.
* Take the initiative and are not afraid to take the first steps to identify and address existing and potential obstacles, issues, and opportunities.


**Requirements**
* Network design and Network architecture
* Deep knowledge and long experience in wireless advanced supporting services/platforms associated to wireless such as: Cisco ISE, Infoblox IPAM, wireless clients of all kinds Cisco Prime, Spaces, Wireless LAN controllers,
* Creating High, and low-level designs
* Planning, design, and lifecycle management networks
* Design and implementation of routing and switching in a complex environment
* The ability to understand business needs transforming them into designs for new services or infrastructure functionalities
* The ability to recognize structural issues within the organization, functional interdependencies, and cross-silo redundancies and apply architectural principles to business solutions
* An understanding of product development from ideation to release.
* Cloud networking and cloud connectivity solutions in a multi-cloud environment
* Understanding of network security ((IPS, proxy, firewall, reverse-proxy, load balancing, VPN),
* Experience in micro-segmentation and profiling
* Good understanding of IP Networking, SDWAN, SD-LAN
* Understanding of Network automation and programming (Scripting, python, ansible, Git, etc.)
* Experience working with APIs and system integrations
* Knowledge of Cisco DevNet
* Handling multivendor environment (e.g. Cisco, HPE)
* Hands-on experience with monitoring, network diagnostic, and network analytics tools companies.
* CCNP or higher (CCIE/CISSP a plus)


**Required cloud certification:** 
 good to have

title: Senior Account Manager Sirocco Group
company_industry: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education
description:
Är du redo att anta utmaningen och bli en del av ett dynamiskt och internationellt CRM-bolag med en framträdande position på marknaden?
   

  

**Om företaget:**
 Sirocco Group är Sveriges äldsta CRM-bolag med hög trovärdighet inom branschen. De är unikt positionerade med en kombination av managementkonsultation och IT-kompetens, vilket gör att de kan förstå kunders affärsprocesser och verksamhetsbehov samt omvandla dessa till skräddarsydda tekniska lösningar. Med kunder inom tillverkningsindustrin och en global närvaro i fem länder, har Sirocco Group byggt en solid grund för att hjälpa företag världen över att optimera sina affärsprocesser. Den dagliga kontakten genom "daily sales calls" erbjuder medarbetarna ett globalt nätverk för kunskapsutbyte och samarbete.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Sirocco Group söker en erfaren Senior Account Manager med fokus på den svenska marknaden. I rollen kommer du att vara en viktig spelare i bolagets fortsatta tillväxt och rapportera till VD. Du ansvarar för en årlig försäljningsbudget på 18-20 miljoner kronor och arbetar med att sälja Siroccos CRM-lösningar till kunder på den svenska marknaden.
   

  

 Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden inkluderar:
   

  

* Aktiv kontakt med kunder via Sales Navigator och nätverkande med partners
* Boka och genomföra fysiska kundmöten med stöttning från marknadsavdelningen som levererar kvalitativt content
* Driva försäljningsprocessen från början till slut, inklusive förhandlingar och avtal
* Delta i internationella dagliga säljmöten för att utbyta insikter och strategier med globala kollegor


 I början får du stöd i kundmöten, men du förväntas snabbt ta eget ansvar och driva affären framåt självständigt.
   

  

**Profil och krav**
 För att lyckas i rollen söker vi dig som redan har etablerat dig i din karriär och är redo för nästa steg. Du har en stark affärsförståelse och drivkraft samt en förmåga att bygga långsiktiga relationer med kunder.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer vi letar efter:
   

  

* Erfarenhet: Minst 5-7 års erfarenhet av att sälja CRM-system. Salesforce och Microsoft är väldigt meriterande
* Nätverk: Du har ett starkt nätverk inom branschen och känner till försäljning metodiken som krävs
* Säljbudget: Beprövad erfarenhet av att hantera och leverera på en försäljningsbudget
* Självgående och initiativrik: Du tar egna initiativ och har förmågan att självständigt driva affärer
* Långsiktighet: En stabil arbetsbakgrund med erfarenhet av att bygga långsiktiga samarbeten utan kortvariga jobbyten
* Internationell erfarenhet: Du talar flytande engelska (tal och skrift) och är bekväm i en internationell kontext och uppskattar samarbetet med kollegor i andra länder


**Övrigt:**
 Plats: Stockholm
   

  

 Start: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Förmåner: En 1-årig säljutbildning med Mikael Arndt, inklusive 25 diplomerande kurser i försäljning och live föreläsningar varje vecka. Du har också möjlighet att delta i Sveriges största säljevent på Oscarsteatern och en 2-dagars säljutbildning på plats i Stockholm för att utvecklas ännu mer som säljare.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Sirocco Group med rekryteringsföretaget Saleshub. Har du frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare på alexander.gohari@saleshub.se
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**

title: Senior Lösningsarkitekt
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd som konsult och arbetar hos kund alt. interna åtaganden gentemot våra kunder.
   

  

**Vår ambitioner**
 Vår målsättning är att vara det ledande IT-konsultföretaget med de mest nöjda medarbetarna och kunderna. Hos oss arbetar du inte för cheferna – ledarskapet är här för att stötta dig. Vi sätter dig i centrum och strävar efter att du ska utvecklas och växa. Vi erbjuder en inspirerande arbetsmiljö med god stämning, intressanta projekt hos intressanta kunder och en stark kultur av kunskapsdelning. Vi har tilltro till våra medarbetares innovationskraft och ger dig och dina kollegor möjlighet att både utvidga och fördjupa era kunskaper.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Lösningsarkitekten arbetar med att hålla ihop standarden på ett tekniskt plan och även att leda utvecklingen av centrala komponenter. Arbetsuppgifterna innehåller att modellera och beskriva ärendeåterkoppling för aktörer, delta i diskussioner om arkitekturella lösningar för ärendeåterkoppling, presentera standarden och lösningen för ett flertal aktörer Sverige samt att delta i diskussioner
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 8 års arbetslivserfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling och därtill hörande arkitekturarbete
* Minst 4 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom modellering
* Minst 4 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att leda utvecklingsarbete
* Erfarenhet av att hålla presentationer och utbildningar


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av att verka i gränslandet mellan verksamhet och teknik
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i myndighetsgemensamma initiativ
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med ärendeåterkoppling


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 16-10-2024
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag seniora IT-specialister, inom bl.a. utveckling, test, testledning, projektledning, databas, Drift, Linux och ser oss alltid om efter fler kompetenta medarbetare.
   

  

 Transparens och flexibilitet är i alla fall viktigt för oss, med oss får man som konsult majoriteten av sin egen intäkt, i snitt har våra medarbetare höjt sin ersättning med 43% och har samtidigt ett av marknadens bästa förmånspaket. De som är med på vår resa idag har en trygg anställning MEN sätter sin egen lön och bestämmer själva över sina förmåner så som pension, utbildning, arbetstid och tjänstebil.
   

  

 Våra kunder finns bland annat inom detaljhandel, bank/finans/försäkring, energi, transport och offentlig sektor. De flesta av våra kunder är i Stockholmsregionen men vi har även kunder i andra delar av landet.
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket garanterar vi ej återkoppling.

title: Cloud Solution Architect: Multi-Cloud Security (Defender for Cloud, Sentinel, CSPM, CNAPP, etc.)
description:
***This job is with Microsoft, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Overview**
 With over 17,000 employees worldwide, the mission of the Customer Experience & Success (CE&S) organization is to empower customers to accelerate business value through differentiated customer experiences that leverage Microsoft’s products and services, ignited by our people and culture. Come join CE&S and help us build a future where customers achieve their business outcomes faster with technology that does more.
   

  

 We are looking for a Cloud Solution Architect (CSA), specializing in Security who is passionate about driving our customers’ security transformation on the Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365 Platforms. This is a customer-facing role, owning the technical relationship between the customer and Microsoft, helping customers to leverage their Microsoft investments through architecture, implementation, and operational health engagements.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND significant experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
+ OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND significant experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
+ OR equivalent experience

* Relevant experience working in a customer-facing role (e.g., internal and/or external)
* Relevant experience working on technical projects
* Technical Certification in Cloud (e.g., Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google, security certifications)
+ Threat protection, SIEM and Incident Response; Extended Detection and Response (XDR); Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR); Security Operation Center Management; Identity and Access Management; Cloud Infrastructure; Cloud Security; Data Security; Certification in one or more of the following technologies preferred: Microsoft 365 Security Administrator, Microsoft Security Operations, Cloud Security, CCSP, CEH, OSCP, GSEC.


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
   

  

 Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will drive positive Customer Satisfaction and become a trusted advisor and provide feedback and insights from customers/partners and be the Voice of Customer to share insights and best practices, connect with Global Security teams at Microsoft, Engineering and Product teams to remove blockers and influence the solution roadmap.
* You will land an end-to-end value prop for Security (i.e., Zero Trust) which spans the breadth of Microsoft Security offerings, and with focus on Threat Protection, ID + Access Management and Cloud Security.
* You will support customers through the adoption lifecycle, through planning, adoption, deployment and optimization as you support increasing drive of Microsoft security products utilization as you lead technical solutioning and nurturing across the customer journey.
* You will deliver technical presentations and demos and propose high-level solutions and work with key Microsoft and Partner resources to drive deployment and customer adoption Identify cross sell/upsell/Unified opportunities through customer engagement.
* You will align your individual skilling to team/area demands and Customer Success goals and accelerate customer outcomes - Share expertise, contribute to IP creation and re-use to accelerate customer outcomes.
* Run Architectural Design Session to build a plan for implementing the solution - governing design in line with customer business goals and their technical environment. Outcome is consensus on solution design and next steps toward production.
* Collaborate and orchestrate with other Cloud Solution Architects and Microsoft stakeholders including FastTrack, partner, and Microsoft Consulting in developing complex end-to-end Enterprise solutions with the Microsoft Security platform.

title: Senior Solution Consultant (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
**Product Manager/Owner - Tietoevry Industry Energy Data Management**
**About Energy Data Management**
 Unlock the power of Energy Data Management (EDM), a cloud-native tool designed to streamline and enhance your energy-related operations. From real-time trade and balancing activities to supporting various business processes, EDM caters to the evolving needs of Balance Responsible Parties (BRP), Retailers (RE), and Distribution System Operators (DSO).
   

  

 This versatile tool also extends its capabilities to district heating/cooling, water metering, and data validation for invoicing. Artificial intelligence and machine learning tools are available for analytics, while Power BI and Excel provide general reporting capabilities.  Elevate your energy management with EDM, part of our Energy Management (EM) platform. Join us in shaping the future of sustainable energy!
   

  

**Role – Product Manager / Owner**
 As a Product Manager/Owner/Solution Consultant for energy data management, your role includes engaging with the market and customers in the business sector, as well as overseeing the development and implementation of our EDM product in collaboration with EM product management. This role requires a deep understanding of the energy markets, developments, data flows, and roles.
   

  

**Other responsibilities:**
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define product requirements and develop product roadmaps aligned with customer needs.
* Identify customer needs, market trends, and opportunities for growth and innovation.
* Develop product strategies that align with business objectives.
* Manage product lifecycles, ensuring that products are launched on time and within budget.
* Monitor product performance to identify areas for improvement.
* Work directly with customers to discuss product roadmap and specifications.
* Collaborate with sales in sales processes.


**Qualifications:**
* Deep understanding of the electricity and other energy commodity markets and responsibilities of different energy market roles.
* Excellent communication skills, able to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.


**What We Offer:**
* Professional growth, meaningful projects, and a good work-life balance.
* Flexible working arrangements, including the ability to work remotely.
* Impactful work and the opportunity to contribute to society.
* International working environment with experienced colleagues.
* Unique learning and growth opportunities.
* Inclusive and supportive community focused on diversity and innovation.
* Join a company with many satisfied customers.


**Did we get you inspired?**
 This role is a unique opportunity to work within our EM product area, specifically with respect to EDM. We’re looking for someone who can bring domain knowledge to our team and effectively relate to our clients. If you’re passionate about the energy market and eager to drive product success, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 For additional information, please contact hiring manager, Nina Fowler, nina.fowler@tietoevry.com or TA-Advisor, Rojin Amini, rojin.amini@tietoevry.com
   

  

**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiarize yourself with what we do.
   

  

 For many years, Tietoevry has been offering essential core systems to the Nordic energy sector. However, with the ongoing energy transition and the increasing importance of digital tools in achieving decarbonization goals, we are adapting our business to better serve our clients and communities by providing digital services to manage the global energy market's transformation.
   

  

*Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good.*
 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Data Engineer
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Utveckla vår framtida plattform inom Data and Analytics
* Påverka arkitektur, teknikval och processer
* Bygga kvalitativa högpresterande datapipelines


 Är du nyfiken på hur den här texten ska sluta? Kul! Vi gillar dig redan. Att vara nyfiken är viktigt för oss.
   

  

 På SBAB spelar nämligen rollen mindre roll. Att du är kunnig förväntar vi oss. Det viktiga är att du vill vara med och bidra till vår kultur, attityd och vårt sätt att vara. Och eftersom vi är lika många experter som medarbetare, behöver alla vara just nyfikna och intresserade av varandras olikheter. Vi lyssnar in och omvärderar kontinuerligt. Vi tror på mångfald, att olika perspektiv berikar och att du är en viktig framgångsfaktor. Fortfarande nyfiken? Välkommen!
   

  

 Att jobba som Data engineer
   

  

 SBAB söker en Data Engineer som tycker om att koda i Python och har ett stort intresse för dataflöden och automatisering. Du trivs med att utveckla högkvalitativ och högpresterande kod med återanvändbara komponenter. Du tycker om det agila arbetssättet och gillar att arbeta tillsammans genom MOB- eller parprogrammering.
   

  

 Du kommer att jobba på Data and Analytics avdelningen på SBAB och höra hemma i ett av avdelningens flera agila och prestigelösa team. Vi har en hybridlösning för vårt analysdata där vi jobbar både med cloud- och on-prem-miljöer med en hög grad av automatisering och DevOps-funktionalitet. Vi har en teknisk roadmap och en vision som vi vill ha din hjälp att utveckla och nå.
   

  

 Blir du glad av att jobba med följande kommer du att trivas:
   

  

* Python och SQL
* Data-lagring (t.ex.i en Delta-lake)
* Pipelines från t.ex. Kafka, API, externa- och tabulära källor
* Hackdays


 Har du även erfarenhet eller intresse av data virtualisering eller har du redan varit i kontakt med mikrotjänster, så är det en bonus. Du är en orädd person som gillar att experimentera och ta initiativ utanför din hemmaarena. Du bör vara flexibel när det kommer till verktyg, och vara öppen för att använda de komponenter som passar det specifika uppdraget. Vi ser gärna att du kan kommunicera väl på svenska i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Har du check på allt?
   

  

* Nyfiken
* Lagspelare
* Högt engagemang
* Självdrivande
* Målmedveten


 Annars då?
   

  

 Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.

title: Senior Data and ML Engineer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 We are looking for a Senior Data and ML Engineer to join an exciting new initiative in Ericsson. We are launching an exciting SaaS initiative that aims to overhaul how we deliver solutions, using As-a-Service on public Hyper Cloud Providers (HCP) as our vehicle. Our goal is twofold: To thrill our customers by delivering services they love and giving them a competitive edge, while building a “lean and mean” product development organization that will allow Ericsson to scale at profit. You will be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You will be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

 If you're passionate about fostering modern product development paradigms, inspiring change, shaping innovative technology to deliver customer value, and you get a kick about building something entirely new, we want you on board!
   

  

**Why join Solution Area Sapper:**
 Ericsson Cloud Software & Services (BCSS) continues to evolve cloud-native portfolio as well as explores new ways of building solutions, including enabling cloud native “as-a-Service” offerings. The newly established Sapper unit will ensure BCSS readiness for “as-a-Service” when our customers start shifting towards new network operations models that could truly maximise the opportunities and agility cloud native deployment brings. We have chosen a less traditional name for our new acceleration unit to signal that this unit will operate differently. The name Sapper originates from a soldier who performs ambitious tasks that require engineering skills, a pioneer with deep technical understanding.
   

  

 With us, you will have an outstanding opportunity: The chance to use your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what is possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems.
   

  

 Within this new area, we are building a number of teams and this particular job specification is for a position as part of the Management Plane Team. In this team we will have responsibility to design and develop the Network Management of this new ‘Core Network as a Service’ offering, and by that we mean functionality such as Life cycle management, Orchestration, Configuration Management, Performance Management, among others. So we aim to design and implement a truly global SaaS management suite with a best in class User interface to manage public cloud deployed Services and infrastructure.
   

  

**Why join our team:**
 We are building a dream team, and this is what we are after…
   

  

* Innovative atmosphere. Be part of a creative, forward-thinking team dedicated to revolutionizing the way we do software.
* Collaborative culture. Work alongside dedicated engineers who share your passion for technology and community building.
* Strong sense of purpose and high impact. Shape the future of our products and directly impact the experience of our customers and developers across our global company.
* Psychological safety. An environment where team members feel comfortable trying new things, voicing their ideas and admitting mistakes without fear of negative repercussions.
* Career growth. We invest in your development, offering opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
* Endless possibilities. Your ideas and innovations won’t just be heard – they’ll be the driving force behind our success.


 What you will do:
   

  

* Design and develop a truly global SaaS Management Plane to manage our ‘as a service’ offerings.
* Work in an agile team using Lean, Agile and DevSecOps methodologies and tooling
* Collaborate with other development teams to ensure our Management SW applications fit and function as part of the overall solution.
* Knowledge share to onboard new team members
* Stay up-to-date with industry standard methodologies and emerging technologies


**The skills you bring:**
* Proficient in Python, Java and Scala
* Experience in the design and implementation of data platforms (ingestion, storage, processing, serving, policy, governance, compliance, security)
* Experience with one or more from Kafka, Hadoop, HBase, Spark, Flink, Airflow
* Experience in Machine Learning
* Bonus qualifications include experience with GCP Big Query, PubSub, Dataflow, Vertex AI, Workflows, Composer
* Experience of programming languages such as Go, Java, Javascript
* Experience of designing APIs (Sync and Async) such as REST, gRPC
* Experience or knowledge of secure design and secure coding (SAST) and DAST
* Experience developing applications in a public cloud such as GCP, AWS, Azure
* Cloud native tools and technologies: containers, Kubernetes
* Knowledge of DevSecOps and CICD and related tools
* Knowledge of Telecoms and in particular Network Management is an advantage


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 755212
   

  

 ]]>
